sentences.zh: 太史公曰：余每讀虞書，至於君臣相敕，維是几安，而股肱不良，萬事墮壞，未嘗不流涕也。

translations.literal: The Grand Historian says: I every time read the Yu Shu, when reaching where ruler and minister mutually admonish each other, only thus being at ease on the cushion, but the limbs not being good, ten thousand affairs falling and ruining, have never not shed tears.
translations.idiomatic: The Grand Historian says: 'Every time I read the Yu Shu, when I reach the part where ruler and minister mutually admonish each other and only thus find ease on the cushion, but the limbs are not good and ten thousand affairs fall into ruin, I have never failed to shed tears.'

sentences.zh: 成王作頌，推己懲艾，悲彼家難，可不謂戰戰恐懼，善守善終哉？

translations.literal: King Cheng made the Ode, pushed himself to punish and restrain, sorrowed over that family's difficulty. Can it not be called fearful and cautious, good at guarding and good at ending?
translations.idiomatic: King Cheng made the Ode, pushed himself to punish and restrain, and sorrowed over that family's difficulties. Can this not be called fearful and cautious, good at guarding and good at bringing things to completion?

sentences.zh: 君子不為約則修德，滿則棄禮，佚能思初，安能惟始，沐浴膏澤而歌詠勤苦，非大德誰能如斯！

translations.literal: The gentleman, when not constrained then cultivates virtue; when full then abandons ritual; at ease can think of the beginning; at peace can only the start; bathes in rich favors and sings of diligent hardships; not great virtue who can be like this!
translations.idiomatic: The gentleman, when not constrained, cultivates virtue; when full, abandons ritual; at ease he can think of the beginning; at peace he can remember the start; he bathes in rich favors and sings of diligent hardships—who but one of great virtue can be like this!

sentences.zh: 傳曰「治定功成，禮樂乃興」。

translations.literal: The tradition says 'When governance is settled and merit achieved, then ritual and music arise'.
translations.idiomatic: The tradition says: 'When governance is settled and merit achieved, then ritual and music arise.'

sentences.zh: 海內人道益深，其德益至，所樂者益異。

translations.literal: Within the seas, the way of humans becomes increasingly deep, their virtue becomes increasingly supreme, what they take joy in becomes increasingly different.
translations.idiomatic: Within the seas, the way of humans becomes increasingly deep; their virtue becomes increasingly supreme; what they take joy in becomes increasingly different.

sentences.zh: 滿而不損則溢，盈而不持則傾。

translations.literal: Full but not diminished then overflows, complete but not held then topples.
translations.idiomatic: When full but not diminished, it overflows; when complete but not held, it topples.

sentences.zh: 凡作樂者，所以節樂。

translations.literal: All those who make music, it is for regulating joy.
translations.idiomatic: All those who make music do so in order to regulate joy.

sentences.zh: 君子以謙退為禮，以損減為樂，樂其如此也。

translations.literal: The gentleman takes modesty and retreat as ritual, takes diminution and reduction as joy, takes joy in it being thus.
translations.idiomatic: The gentleman takes modesty and retreat as ritual, takes diminution and reduction as joy, and takes joy in it being thus.

sentences.zh: 以為州異國殊，情習不同，故博采風俗，協比聲律，以補短移化，助流政教。

translations.literal: Considering that provinces differ and states are disparate, feelings and habits are not the same, therefore broadly gather customs, harmonize and compare tone laws, to supplement shortcomings and shift transformations, assist in flowing governance and teachings.
translations.idiomatic: Considering that provinces differ and states are disparate, that feelings and habits are not the same, therefore they broadly gather customs and harmonize and compare tone laws, to supplement shortcomings and shift transformations, and assist in flowing governance and teachings.

sentences.zh: 天子躬於明堂臨觀，而萬民咸蕩滌邪穢，斟酌飽滿，以飾厥性。

translations.literal: The Son of Heaven personally in the Bright Hall oversees and watches, and the ten thousand people all wash away evil impurities, measure and fill to fullness, to adorn their natures.
translations.idiomatic: The Son of Heaven personally oversees and watches from the Bright Hall, and the ten thousand people all wash away evil impurities, measure and fill to fullness, in order to adorn their natures.

sentences.zh: 故云雅頌之音理而民正，嘄噭之聲興而士奮，鄭衛之曲動而心淫。

translations.literal: Therefore it is said the sounds of ya and song order and the people are correct, the voices of yu and jiao arise and the scholars are aroused, the tunes of Zheng and Wei move and the hearts are licentious.
translations.idiomatic: Therefore it is said that the sounds of ya and song bring order and the people are correct; the voices of yu and jiao arise and the scholars are aroused; the tunes of Zheng and Wei move and the hearts become licentious.

sentences.zh: 及其調和諧合，鳥獸盡感，而況懷五常，含好惡，自然之勢也？

translations.literal: When reaching its harmonious blending and musical union, birds and beasts all are moved, how much more those who harbor the five constants, contain likes and dislikes, it is the natural tendency.
translations.idiomatic: When it reaches harmonious blending and musical union, even birds and beasts are all moved—how much more so those who harbor the five constants and contain likes and dislikes? It is the natural tendency.

translations.literal: The Grand Historian says: I have often read the Yu Shu, reaching the point where ruler and minister mutually admonish, only then is the state secure, but if the limbs are not good, ten thousand affairs fall into ruin, I have never not shed tears. Cheng Wang made the Song, pushed himself to punish and reform, grieved those family difficulties, can it not be called trembling with fear, good at guarding and good at ending? The gentleman when not constrained then cultivates virtue, when full then abandons ritual, at ease can think of the beginning, secure can remember the start, bathed in rich favor while singing of hardship, who but great virtue can be like this! The tradition says 'When governance is settled and merit complete, ritual and music then flourish'. Within the seas human way grew deeper, their virtue grew more complete, what they took joy in grew more refined. Full without decrease then overflows, complete without holding then topples. All music making is to moderate joy. The gentleman takes humility and withdrawal as ritual, takes decrease and reduction as joy, takes joy in this way. Considering that provinces differ and states vary, feelings and customs differ, thus broadly gather customs, harmonize and compare tones and rhythms, to supplement shortcomings and shift transformation, assist flowing governance and teaching. The Son of Heaven personally at the Bright Hall observes, and the myriad people all wash away evil impurity, ladle full to the brim, to adorn their nature. Thus it is said the sounds of ya and song order and people are correct, the sounds of jiao jiao arise and scholars strive, the tunes of Zheng and Wei move and hearts become licentious. When it reaches harmonious blending, birds and beasts all are moved, and moreover those embracing the five constants, containing likes and dislikes, it is the natural tendency.

sentences.zh: 治道虧缺而鄭音興起，封君世辟，名顯鄰州，爭以相高。

translations.literal: The way of governance is deficient and Zheng music arises, enfeoffed lords become hereditary ministers, names become illustrious in neighboring states, contending to surpass each other.
translations.idiomatic: The way of governance becomes deficient and Zheng music arises; enfeoffed lords become hereditary ministers; names become illustrious in neighboring states; they contend to surpass each other.

sentences.zh: 自仲尼不能與齊優遂容於魯，雖退正樂以誘世，作五章以剌時，猶莫之化。

translations.literal: Since Confucius could not together with the Qi entertainers find accommodation in Lu, although he retreated to correct music to guide the world, made five chapters to criticize the times, still none transformed them.
translations.idiomatic: Since Confucius could not find accommodation in Lu together with the Qi entertainers, although he retreated to correct music in order to guide the world and made five chapters to criticize the times, still none transformed them.

sentences.zh: 陵遲以至六國，流沔沈佚，遂往不返，卒於喪身滅宗，并國於秦。

translations.literal: Gradually declining to reach the Six States, flowing and sinking into dissipation, going forth never to return, finally resulting in losing life and destroying the lineage, merging states into Qin.
translations.idiomatic: Gradually declining until reaching the Six States, flowing and sinking into dissipation, going forth never to return, finally resulting in losing life and destroying lineages, merging the states into Qin.

translations.literal: When the way of governance is deficient and Zheng music arises, enfeoffed lords generation after generation become powerful, names illustrious in neighboring states, contend to surpass each other. Since Zhong Ni could not make the Qi actor tolerate him in Lu, though he retreated to correct music to guide the age, made five chapters to criticize the times, still none were transformed. Declining to reach the six states, flowing and sinking in dissipation, went away never to return, finally perished body and extinguished clan, united state to Qin.

sentences.zh: 秦二世尤以為娛。

translations.literal: Qin Er Shi especially took it as entertainment.
translations.idiomatic: Qin Er Shi especially took it as entertainment.

sentences.zh: 丞相李斯進諫曰：「放棄詩書，極意聲色，祖伊所以懼也；

translations.literal: Chancellor Li Si advanced remonstrance saying: 'Abandoning poetry and books, exhausting intention on sounds and colors, this is what Zu Yi feared;
translations.idiomatic: Chancellor Li Si advanced a remonstrance saying: 'Abandoning poetry and books, exhausting one's intention on sounds and colors—this is what Zu Yi feared.'

sentences.zh: 輕積細過，恣心長夜，紂所以亡也。」

translations.literal: Lightly accumulating small faults, indulging heart in long nights, this is why Zhou perished.'
translations.idiomatic: 'Lightly accumulating small faults, indulging the heart in long nights—this is why Zhou perished.'

sentences.zh: 趙高曰：「五帝、三王樂各殊名，示不相襲。

translations.literal: Zhao Gao said: 'The Five Emperors and Three Kings' music each had different names, showing they did not copy each other.
translations.idiomatic: Zhao Gao said: 'The Five Emperors and Three Kings' music each had different names, showing they did not copy each other.'

sentences.zh: 上自朝廷，下至人民，得以接歡喜，合殷勤，非此和說不通，解澤不流，亦各一世之化，度時之樂，何必華山之騄耳而後行遠乎？」

translations.literal: From the court above, down to the people below, they could connect happiness and joy, unite diligence and care. Without this, harmonious persuasion would not pass through, dissolving favor would not flow. Each is also one era's transformation, timely joy. Why must it be the Hua Mountain liu'er and only then travel far?'
translations.idiomatic: 'From the court above down to the people below, they could connect happiness and joy, unite diligence and care. Without this, harmonious persuasion would not pass through, dissolving favor would not flow. Each is also one era's transformation, timely joy. Why must it be the Hua Mountain liu'er and only then travel far?'

sentences.zh: 二世然之。

translations.literal: Er Shi approved of this.
translations.idiomatic: Er Shi approved of this.

translations.literal: Qin Er Shi especially took it as entertainment. Chancellor Li Si advanced remonstrance saying: 'Abandon poetry and books, extreme in sounds and colors, Zu Yi thus feared; Lightly accumulate minor faults, indulge heart in long night, Zhou thus perished.' Zhao Gao said: 'The Five Emperors, Three Kings music each had different names, showing they did not imitate each other. Above from the court, below to the people, they can connect joy and happiness, unite attentiveness, not this harmonious delight does not communicate, the dissolving favor does not flow, also each age's transformation, measure of the times' joy, why must it be the Huashan black-eared horse then goes far?' Er Shi approved it.

sentences.zh: 高祖過沛詩三侯之章，令小兒歌之。

translations.literal: Gao Zu, passing through Pei, recited the chapters of the Three Hou, commanded children to sing them.
translations.idiomatic: When Gao Zu passed through Pei, he recited the chapters of the Three Hou and commanded children to sing them.

sentences.zh: 高祖崩，令沛得以四時歌儛宗廟。

translations.literal: When Gao Zu passed away, he commanded that Pei could use the four seasons to sing and dance in the ancestral temple.
translations.idiomatic: When Gao Zu passed away, he commanded that Pei could use the four seasons to sing and dance in the ancestral temple.

sentences.zh: 孝惠、孝文、孝景無所增更，於樂府習常肄舊而已。

translations.literal: Xiao Hui, Xiao Wen, Xiao Jing made no additions or changes; at the Music Bureau they only practiced the constant and reviewed the old.
translations.idiomatic: Xiao Hui, Xiao Wen, and Xiao Jing made no additions or changes; at the Music Bureau they only practiced the constant and reviewed the old.

translations.literal: Gao Zu passed Pei sang the three marquess chapter, commanded children to sing it. Gao Zu collapsed, commanded Pei to use the four seasons to sing and dance at the ancestral temple. Xiao Hui, Xiao Wen, Xiao Jing made no additions or changes, at the Music Bureau practiced the constant and reviewed the old only.

sentences.zh: 至今上即位，作十九章，令侍中李延年次序其聲，拜為協律都尉。

translations.literal: Until the present emperor ascended the throne, he made nineteen chapters, commanded the palace attendant Li Yan Nian to sequence their sounds, appointed him as Harmonious Music Commandant.
translations.idiomatic: Until the present emperor ascended the throne, he made nineteen chapters, commanded the palace attendant Li Yan Nian to sequence their sounds, and appointed him as Harmonious Music Commandant.

sentences.zh: 通一經之士不能獨知其辭，皆集會五經家，相與共講習讀之，乃能通知其意，多爾雅之文。

translations.literal: Scholars who master one classic cannot alone know their words; all gather the Five Classics scholars, mutually together lecture, practice, and read them; only then can they fully understand their meaning, many refined and elegant writings.
translations.idiomatic: Scholars who master one classic cannot alone know their words; all gather the Five Classics scholars, mutually lecture, practice, and read them together; only then can they fully understand their meaning—many refined and elegant writings.

translations.literal: Until the current emperor ascended the throne, made nineteen chapters, commanded Attendant Li Yan Nian to arrange their sounds, appointed as Harmonious Rhythms Colonel. Those who master one classic cannot alone know its words, all gather the five classics scholars, mutually discuss and practice read it, then can thoroughly understand its meaning, much elegant and correct writing.

sentences.zh: 漢家常以正月上辛祠太一甘泉，以昏時夜祠，到明而終。

translations.literal: The Han house constantly in the first month, first xin day, sacrificed to Tai Yi at Gan Quan, using dusk time for night sacrifice, reaching dawn and ending.
translations.idiomatic: The Han house constantly, in the first month on the first xin day, sacrificed to Tai Yi at Gan Quan, using dusk time for the night sacrifice, reaching dawn and ending.

sentences.zh: 常有流星經於祠壇上。

translations.literal: There constantly were shooting stars passing over the sacrificial altar.
translations.idiomatic: There constantly were shooting stars passing over the sacrificial altar.

sentences.zh: 使僮男僮女七十人俱歌。

translations.literal: He made young boys and young girls, seventy people together, sing.
translations.idiomatic: He made young boys and young girls—seventy people in all—sing together.

sentences.zh: 春歌青陽，夏歌朱明，秋歌西暤，冬歌玄冥。

translations.literal: Spring sang Qing Yang, summer sang Zhu Ming, autumn sang Xi Huang, winter sang Xuan Ming.
translations.idiomatic: In the spring they sang Qing Yang; in the summer they sang Zhu Ming; in the autumn they sang Xi Huang; in the winter they sang Xuan Ming.

sentences.zh: 世多有，故不論。

translations.literal: The world has many such, therefore not discussed.
translations.idiomatic: The world has many such, therefore they are not discussed.

translations.literal: Han house constantly in first month upper xin sacrifices Tai Yi at Gan Quan, with dusk time night sacrifice, arrives at dawn and ends. Constantly had shooting star pass over the sacrifice altar. Made boy servants and girl servants seventy people all sing together. Spring sings Qing Yang, summer sings Zhu Ming, autumn sings Xi Hai, winter sings Xuan Ming. The world has many such, thus not discussed.

sentences.zh: 又嘗得神馬渥洼水中，復次以為太一之歌。

translations.literal: Again once obtained divine horses in Wo Wa water, and furthermore made it into the Tai Yi song.
translations.idiomatic: He once again obtained divine horses in the Wo Wa water, and furthermore made it into the Tai Yi song.

sentences.zh: 歌曲曰：「太一貢兮天馬下，霑赤汗兮沫流赭。

translations.literal: The song and lyrics say: 'Tai Yi contributes, heaven horse descends; moistened with red sweat, foam flows crimson.
translations.idiomatic: The song and lyrics say: 'Tai Yi contributes, the heavenly horse descends; moistened with red sweat, foam flows crimson.'

sentences.zh: 騁容與兮跇萬里，今安匹兮龍為友。」

translations.literal: Galloping at ease, traversing ten thousand li; now what match, dragon as friend.'
translations.idiomatic: 'Galloping at ease, traversing ten thousand li; now what match has it, with the dragon as friend.'

sentences.zh: 後伐大宛得千里馬，馬名蒲梢，次作以為歌。

translations.literal: Later attacked Da Yuan and obtained thousand-li horses, horse named Pu Shao, furthermore made it into a song.
translations.idiomatic: Later he attacked Dayuan and obtained thousand-li horses; the horse was named Pu Shao, and furthermore he made it into a song.

sentences.zh: 歌詩曰：「天馬來兮從西極，經萬里兮歸有德。

translations.literal: The song and poem say: 'Heaven horse comes from the western extreme; traverses ten thousand li and returns to one with virtue.
translations.idiomatic: The song and poem say: 'The heavenly horse comes from the western extreme; traverses ten thousand li and returns to one with virtue.'

sentences.zh: 承靈威兮降外國，涉流沙兮四夷服。」

translations.literal: Receives spiritual might, descends to foreign countries; crosses flowing sands, four barbarians submit.'
translations.idiomatic: 'Receives spiritual might, descends to foreign countries; crosses flowing sands, the four barbarians submit.'

sentences.zh: 中尉汲黯進曰：「凡王者作樂，上以承祖宗，下以化兆民。

translations.literal: The Commandant Ji An advanced and said: 'All kings who make music, above to receive ancestors, below to transform the myriad people.
translations.idiomatic: The Commandant Ji An advanced and said: 'All kings who make music do so above to receive the ancestors, below to transform the myriad people.'

sentences.zh: 今陛下得馬，詩以為歌，協於宗廟，先帝百姓豈能知其音邪？」

translations.literal: Now Your Majesty obtains horses, makes poems into songs, performs them in the ancestral temple; the former emperors and people, how could they know their sounds?'
translations.idiomatic: 'Now Your Majesty obtains horses, makes poems into songs, and performs them in the ancestral temple; how could the former emperors and the people know their sounds?'

sentences.zh: 上默然不說。

translations.literal: The emperor was silently displeased.
translations.idiomatic: The emperor was silently displeased.

sentences.zh: 丞相公孫弘曰：「黯誹謗聖制，當族。」

translations.literal: Chancellor Gongsun Hong said: 'An slanders the sacred system, should be executed along with his clan.'
translations.idiomatic: Chancellor Gongsun Hong said: 'An slanders the sacred system; he should be executed along with his clan.'

translations.literal: Also once obtained divine horse in Wo Wo water, moreover arranged it as Tai Yi song. Song lyrics say: 'Tai Yi sends down the heavenly horse, moistens red sweat flows foam crimson. Gallops at ease crosses ten thousand li, now has companion dragon as friend.' Later attacked Da Yuan obtained thousand li horse, horse named Pu Shao, moreover made it as song. Song poem says: 'Heavenly horse comes from western extreme, crosses ten thousand li returns to virtuous. Receives spiritual might descends foreign lands, crosses flowing sands four barbarians submit.' Colonel Ji Pian advanced saying: 'All kings who make music, above to receive ancestors, below to transform the myriad people. Now Your Majesty obtains horse, makes poem as song, harmonizes at ancestral temple, former emperors and people how can they know its sound?' The emperor was silent not pleased. Chancellor Gong Sun Hong said: 'Pian slanders the sacred system, should be exterminated.'

sentences.zh: 凡音之起，由人心生也。

translations.literal: All sounds that arise, are born from the human heart.
translations.idiomatic: All sounds that arise are born from the human heart.

sentences.zh: 人心之動，物使之然也。

translations.literal: The human heart's movement, things make it thus.
translations.idiomatic: The movement of the human heart is made thus by things.

sentences.zh: 感於物而動，故形於聲；

translations.literal: Moved by things and thus acts, therefore takes form in sound;
translations.idiomatic: Moved by things and thus moved, it therefore takes form in sound.

sentences.zh: 聲相應，故生變；

translations.literal: Sounds respond to each other, therefore give rise to change;
translations.idiomatic: Sounds respond to each other, therefore giving rise to change.

sentences.zh: 變成方，謂之音；

translations.literal: Change becomes regular, this is called sound;
translations.idiomatic: When change becomes regular, this is called sound.

sentences.zh: 比音而樂之，及干戚羽旄，謂之樂也。

translations.literal: Compare sounds and take joy in them, and the gan, qi, yu, mao, this is called music.
translations.idiomatic: To compare sounds and take joy in them, together with the gan, qi, yu, and mao—this is called music.

sentences.zh: 樂者，音之所由生也，其本在人心感於物也。

translations.literal: Music is that from which sound is born, its root is in the human heart being moved by things.
translations.idiomatic: Music is that from which sound is born; its root is in the human heart being moved by things.

sentences.zh: 是故其哀心感者，其聲噍以殺；

translations.literal: Therefore those whose sorrowful heart is moved, their sound is anxious and subdued;
translations.idiomatic: Therefore, those whose sorrowful heart is moved have sounds that are anxious and subdued.

sentences.zh: 其樂心感者，其聲啴以緩；

translations.literal: Those whose joyful heart is moved, their sound is harmonious and gentle;
translations.idiomatic: Those whose joyful heart is moved have sounds that are harmonious and gentle.

sentences.zh: 其喜心感者，其聲發以散；

translations.literal: Those whose happy heart is moved, their sound is open and dispersed;
translations.idiomatic: Those whose happy heart is moved have sounds that are open and dispersed.

sentences.zh: 其怒心感者，其聲麤以厲；

translations.literal: Those whose angry heart is moved, their sound is coarse and harsh;
translations.idiomatic: Those whose angry heart is moved have sounds that are coarse and harsh.

sentences.zh: 其敬心感者，其聲直以廉；

translations.literal: Those whose respectful heart is moved, their sound is straight and upright;
translations.idiomatic: Those whose respectful heart is moved have sounds that are straight and upright.

sentences.zh: 其愛心感者，其聲和以柔。

translations.literal: Those whose loving heart is moved, their sound is harmonious and soft.
translations.idiomatic: Those whose loving heart is moved have sounds that are harmonious and soft.

sentences.zh: 六者非性也，感於物而後動，是故先王慎所以感之。

translations.literal: These six are not nature, moved by things and only then act, therefore the former kings were careful about what moves them.
translations.idiomatic: These six are not nature; they are moved by things and only then act. Therefore, the former kings were careful about what moves them.

sentences.zh: 故禮以導其志，樂以和其聲，政以壹其行，刑以防其姦。

translations.literal: Therefore ritual guides their will, music harmonizes their sound, governance unites their conduct, punishment prevents their wickedness.
translations.idiomatic: Therefore, the ritual guides their will; the music harmonizes their sound; the governance unites their conduct; the punishment prevents their wickedness.

sentences.zh: 禮樂刑政，其極一也，所以同民心而出治道也。

translations.literal: Ritual, music, punishment, governance—their ultimate goal is one, to unify the people's hearts and bring forth the way of governance.
translations.idiomatic: Ritual, music, punishment, and governance—their ultimate goal is one: to unify the people's hearts and bring forth the way of governance.

translations.literal: All sound arises from the human heart. The human heart's movement, things cause it so. Moved by things thus takes form in sound; Sounds respond thus give rise to change; Change becomes pattern, called sound; Compare sounds and take joy in them, and with shields axes feathers banners, called music. Music is that from which sound is born, its root is in the human heart moved by things. Thus those whose sorrowful heart is moved, their sound is high and sharp; Those whose joyful heart is moved, their sound smooth slow; Those whose happy heart is moved, their sound issue scatter; Those whose angry heart is moved, their sound coarse fierce; Those whose respectful heart is moved, their sound straight pure; Those whose loving heart is moved, their sound harmonious soft. Six not nature, moved by things then act, thus former kings careful what move them. Thus ritual to guide their will, music to harmonize their sound, governance to unify their conduct, punishment to guard their evil. Ritual music punishment governance, their extreme one, thus same people's hearts and issue governance way.

sentences.zh: 凡音者，生人心者也。

translations.literal: All sound is that which gives birth to the human heart.
translations.idiomatic: All sound is that which gives birth to the human heart.

sentences.zh: 情動於中，故形於聲，聲成文謂之音。

translations.literal: Emotions move within, therefore take form in sound; sound becomes patterned and is called tone.
translations.idiomatic: The emotions move within, therefore taking form in sound; when the sound becomes patterned, it is called tone.

sentences.zh: 是故治世之音安以樂，其正和；

translations.literal: Therefore the sound of an orderly age is peaceful and joyful, its correctness harmonious;
translations.idiomatic: Therefore, the sound of an orderly age is peaceful and joyful; its correctness is harmonious.

sentences.zh: 亂世之音怨以怒，其正乖；

translations.literal: The sound of a chaotic age is resentful and angry, its correctness perverse;
translations.idiomatic: The sound of a chaotic age is resentful and angry; its correctness is perverse.

sentences.zh: 亡國之音哀以思，其民困。

translations.literal: The sound of a perishing state is sorrowful and longing, its people distressed.
translations.idiomatic: The sound of a perishing state is sorrowful and longing; its people are distressed.

sentences.zh: 聲音之道，與正通矣。

translations.literal: The way of sound and tone communicates with correctness.
translations.idiomatic: The way of sound and tone communicates with correctness.

sentences.zh: 宮為君，商為臣，角為民，徵為事，羽為物。

translations.literal: Gong represents the ruler, shang the ministers, jue the people, zhi affairs, yu things.
translations.idiomatic: Gong represents the ruler; shang the ministers; jue the people; zhi affairs; yu things.

sentences.zh: 五者不亂，則無惉懘之音矣。

translations.literal: If these five are not chaotic, then there will be no sounds of worry and sorrow.
translations.idiomatic: If these five are not chaotic, then there will be no sounds of worry and sorrow.

sentences.zh: 宮亂則荒，其君驕；

translations.literal: If gong is chaotic then wild, its ruler arrogant;
translations.idiomatic: If gong is chaotic, then it is wild; its ruler is arrogant.

sentences.zh: 商亂則搥，其臣壞；

translations.literal: If shang is chaotic then broken, its ministers ruined;
translations.idiomatic: If shang is chaotic, then it is broken; its ministers are ruined.

sentences.zh: 角亂則憂，其民怨；

translations.literal: If jue is chaotic then sorrowful, its people resentful;
translations.idiomatic: If jue is chaotic, then it is sorrowful; its people are resentful.

sentences.zh: 徵亂則哀，其事勤；

translations.literal: If zhi is chaotic then mournful, its affairs laborious;
translations.idiomatic: If zhi is chaotic, then it is mournful; its affairs are laborious.

sentences.zh: 羽亂則危，其財匱。

translations.literal: If yu is chaotic then dangerous, its wealth depleted.
translations.idiomatic: If yu is chaotic, then it is dangerous; its wealth is depleted.

sentences.zh: 五者皆亂，迭相陵，謂之慢。

translations.literal: If all five are chaotic, mutually encroaching upon each other, this is called laxity.
translations.idiomatic: If all five are chaotic, mutually encroaching upon each other, this is called laxity.

sentences.zh: 如此則國之滅亡無日矣。

translations.literal: In this way then the state's destruction has no day left.
translations.idiomatic: In this way, the state's destruction has no day left.

sentences.zh: 鄭衛之音，亂世之音也，比於慢矣。

translations.literal: The sounds of Zheng and Wei are the sounds of a chaotic age, comparable to laxity.
translations.idiomatic: The sounds of Zheng and Wei are the sounds of a chaotic age, comparable to laxity.

sentences.zh: 桑閒濮上之音，亡國之音也，其政散，其民流，誣上行私而不可止。

translations.literal: The sounds of Sang Jian and Pu Shang are the sounds of a perishing state; their governance scattered; their people flowing away; deceiving superiors and practicing selfishness without being able to stop.
translations.idiomatic: The sounds of Sang Jian and Pu Shang are the sounds of a perishing state; their governance is scattered; their people are flowing away; deceiving superiors and practicing selfishness without being able to stop.

translations.literal: All sound, born human heart. Feelings move within, thus form in sound, sound forms pattern called sound. Thus orderly age sound peaceful joyful, its correct harmony; Chaotic age sound resentful angry, its correct contrary; Perished state sound sorrowful thoughtful, its people distressed. Sound way, with correct connects. Gong for ruler, shang for minister, jue for people, zhi for affairs, yu for things. Five not chaotic, then no worried sounds. Gong chaotic then wild, its ruler arrogant; Shang chaotic then strike, its ministers ruined; Jue chaotic then worry, its people resentful; Zhi chaotic then sorrow, its affairs diligent; Yu chaotic then dangerous, its wealth scarce. Five all chaotic, mutually invade, called slow. Thus then state's extinction no day. Zheng Wei sounds, chaotic age sounds, close to slow. Sang Jian Pu Shang sounds, perished state sounds, its governance scattered, its people flow, deceive superiors carry private cannot stop.

sentences.zh: 凡音者，生於人心者也；

translations.literal: All sound is that which is born from the human heart;
translations.idiomatic: All sound is that which is born from the human heart.

sentences.zh: 樂者，通於倫理者也。

translations.literal: Music is that which communicates with proper relationships.
translations.idiomatic: Music is that which communicates with proper relationships.

sentences.zh: 是故知聲而不知音者，禽獸是也；

translations.literal: Therefore those who know sound but do not know tone are birds and beasts;
translations.idiomatic: Therefore, those who know sound but do not know tone are birds and beasts.

sentences.zh: 知音而不知樂者，眾庶是也。

translations.literal: Those who know tone but do not know music are the common people.
translations.idiomatic: Those who know tone but do not know music are the common people.

sentences.zh: 唯君子為能知樂。

translations.literal: Only the gentleman is able to know music.
translations.idiomatic: Only the gentleman is able to know music.

sentences.zh: 是故審聲以知音，審音以知樂，審樂以知政，而治道備矣。

translations.literal: Therefore examine sound to know tone, examine tone to know music, examine music to know governance, and the way of governance is complete.
translations.idiomatic: Therefore, examine sound to know tone; examine tone to know music; examine music to know governance; and the way of governance is complete.

sentences.zh: 是故不知聲者不可與言音，不知音者不可與言樂知樂則幾於禮矣。

translations.literal: Therefore those who do not know sound cannot speak of tone with them, those who do not know tone cannot speak of music with them; knowing music then approaches ritual.
translations.idiomatic: Therefore, those who do not know the sound cannot speak of the tone with them; those who do not know the tone cannot speak of the music with them; knowing the music then approaches the ritual.

sentences.zh: 禮樂皆得，謂之有德。

translations.literal: If both ritual and music are obtained, this is called having virtue.
translations.idiomatic: If both ritual and music are obtained, this is called having virtue.

sentences.zh: 德者得也。

translations.literal: Virtue is obtaining.
translations.idiomatic: Virtue is obtaining.

sentences.zh: 是故樂之隆，非極音也；

translations.literal: Therefore music's flourishing is not the extreme of sound;
translations.idiomatic: Therefore, music's flourishing is not the extreme of sound.

sentences.zh: 食饗之禮，非極味也。

translations.literal: The ritual of eating feasts is not the extreme of flavor.
translations.idiomatic: The ritual of eating feasts is not the extreme of flavor.

sentences.zh: 清廟之瑟，朱弦而疏越，一倡而三嘆，有遺音者矣。

translations.literal: The qing temple's se, crimson strings and sparse bridges, one leads and three sigh, there are lingering tones.
translations.idiomatic: The qing temple's se, with crimson strings and sparse bridges, one leads and three sigh—there are lingering tones.

sentences.zh: 大饗之禮，尚玄酒而俎腥魚，大羹不和，有遺味者矣。

translations.literal: The great feast ritual honors dark wine and platters of raw fish, great broth unmixed, there are lingering flavors.
translations.idiomatic: The great feast ritual honors dark wine and platters of raw fish, great broth unmixed—there are lingering flavors.

sentences.zh: 是故先王之制禮樂也，非以極口腹耳目之欲也，將以教民平好惡而反人道之正也。

translations.literal: Therefore the former kings' establishment of ritual and music was not to satisfy mouth, belly, ear, eye desires, but to teach the people to balance likes and dislikes and return to the correctness of the human way.
translations.idiomatic: Therefore, the former kings' establishment of ritual and music was not to satisfy the desires of mouth, belly, ear, and eye, but to teach the people to balance likes and dislikes and return to the correctness of the human way.

translations.literal: All sound, born human heart; Music, connects principles ethics. Thus know sound not know sound, birds beasts are; Know sound not know music, common people are. Only gentleman can know music. Thus examine sound to know sound, examine sound to know music, examine music to know governance, governance way complete. Thus not know sound cannot speak sound with, not know sound cannot speak music know music then near ritual. Ritual music all obtained, called has virtue. Virtue is obtain. Thus music's flourishing, not extreme sound; Feast ritual, not extreme flavor. Clear temple qin, vermilion strings sparse bridges, one lead three sigh, has remaining sound. Great feast ritual, still black wine zu raw fish, great broth not mixed, has remaining flavor. Thus former kings' establish ritual music, not to extreme mouth belly ears eyes desires, will teach people even likes dislikes return human way correct.

sentences.zh: 人生而靜，天之性也；

translations.literal: Humans are born quiet, heaven's nature;
translations.idiomatic: Humans are born quiet; it is heaven's nature.

sentences.zh: 感於物而動，性之頌也。

translations.literal: Moved by things and acting, nature's expression.
translations.idiomatic: Being moved by things and acting is nature's expression.

sentences.zh: 物至知知，然後好惡形焉。

translations.literal: Things arrive and knowledge knows, then likes and dislikes take form.
translations.idiomatic: Things arrive and knowledge knows them, then likes and dislikes take form.

sentences.zh: 好惡無節於內，知誘於外，不能反己，天理滅矣。

translations.literal: Likes and dislikes without measure within, knowledge seduced by externals, cannot return to self, heavenly principle extinguished.
translations.idiomatic: The likes and dislikes without measure within, the knowledge seduced by externals, cannot return to self—the heavenly principle is extinguished.

sentences.zh: 夫物之感人無窮，而人之好惡無節，則是物至而人化物也。

translations.literal: Indeed things' moving people is endless, and humans' likes and dislikes without measure, then things arrive and humans transform into things.
translations.idiomatic: Indeed, the things moving people is endless, and the humans likes and dislikes are without measure; then things arrive and humans transform into things.

sentences.zh: 人化物也者，滅天理而窮人欲者也。

translations.literal: Humans transforming into things is extinguishing heavenly principle and exhausting human desires.
translations.idiomatic: Humans transforming into things is extinguishing the heavenly principle and exhausting human desires.

sentences.zh: 於是有悖逆詐偽之心，有淫佚作亂之事。

translations.literal: Thereupon there are hearts of perversity, deceit, falsity; there are matters of licentiousness, dissipation, rebellion, disorder.
translations.idiomatic: Thereupon there are the hearts of perversity, deceit, and falsity; there are the matters of licentiousness, dissipation, rebellion, and disorder.

sentences.zh: 是故彊者脅弱，眾者暴寡，知者詐愚，勇者苦怯，疾病不養，老幼孤寡不得其所，此大亂之道也。

translations.literal: Therefore the strong coerce the weak, the many tyrannize the few, the knowledgeable deceive the ignorant, the brave torment the cowardly, the sick and disabled are not nurtured, the old, young, orphans, widows do not get their place; this is the way of great chaos.
translations.idiomatic: Therefore, the strong coerce the weak; the many tyrannize the few; the knowledgeable deceive the ignorant; the brave torment the cowardly; the sick and disabled are not nurtured; the old, young, orphans, and widows do not get their proper place—this is the way of great chaos.

sentences.zh: 是故先王制禮樂，人為之節：衰麻哭泣，所以節喪紀也；

translations.literal: Therefore the former kings established ritual and music, humans made measures for them: mourning garments, weeping, crying, these regulate mourning rites;
translations.idiomatic: Therefore, the former kings established ritual and music, humans made measures for them: mourning garments, weeping, crying—these regulate mourning rites.

sentences.zh: 鐘鼓干戚，所以和安樂也；

translations.literal: Bells, drums, shields, axes, these harmonize peaceful joy;
translations.idiomatic: Bells, drums, shields, and axes—these harmonize peaceful joy.

sentences.zh: 婚姻冠笄，所以別男女也；

translations.literal: Marriage, capping, hair-pinning, these distinguish male and female;
translations.idiomatic: Marriage, capping, and hair-pinning—these distinguish male and female.

sentences.zh: 射鄉食饗，所以正交接也。

translations.literal: Archery, neighborhood meetings, feasts, these correct social interactions.
translations.idiomatic: Archery, neighborhood meetings, and feasts—these correct social interactions.

sentences.zh: 禮節民心，樂和民聲，政以行之，刑以防之。

translations.literal: Ritual regulates the people's hearts, music harmonizes the people's voices, governance implements them, punishment prevents them.
translations.idiomatic: Ritual regulates the people's hearts; music harmonizes the people's voices; governance implements them; punishment prevents them.

sentences.zh: 禮樂刑政四達而不悖，則王道備矣。

translations.literal: Ritual, music, punishment, governance four reach without contradiction, then the kingly way is complete.
translations.idiomatic: Ritual, music, punishment, and governance reach in all four directions without contradiction, then the kingly way is complete.

translations.literal: Human life quiet, heaven's nature; Moved by things act, nature's endowment. Things arrive know know, then likes dislikes form. Likes dislikes no measure within, knowledge lured without, cannot return self, heaven principle extinguished. Things move people infinite, human likes dislikes no measure, then things arrive human transform things. Human transform things, extinguish heaven principle exhaust human desires. Thus have contrary deceit false heart, have licentious dissipation make chaos affairs. Thus strong coerce weak, many violent few, wise deceive foolish, brave oppress cowardly, sickness not nurture, old young orphans widows not get place, this great chaos way. Thus former kings establish ritual music, human make measure: mourning hemp cry weep, thus measure mourning record; Bells drums shield axe, thus harmonize peaceful joy; Marriage capping and hair-pinning, thus to distinguish male and female; Archery village feasts, thus to correct intercourse. Ritual moderates the people's hearts, music harmonizes the people's sounds, governance to carry it out, punishment to guard against it. Ritual music punishment governance four reach without contradiction, then the kingly way is complete.

sentences.zh: 樂者為同，禮者為異。

translations.literal: Music is for sameness, ritual is for difference.
translations.idiomatic: Music is for sameness; ritual is for difference.

sentences.zh: 同則相親，異則相敬。

translations.literal: Sameness then mutually intimate, difference then mutually respectful.
translations.idiomatic: Sameness then mutually intimate; difference then mutually respectful.

sentences.zh: 樂勝則流，禮勝則離。

translations.literal: If music prevails then licentious, if ritual prevails then distant.
translations.idiomatic: If music prevails, then it becomes licentious; if ritual prevails, then it becomes distant.

sentences.zh: 合情飾貌者，禮樂之事也。

translations.literal: Uniting emotions and adorning appearances is the matter of ritual and music.
translations.idiomatic: Uniting emotions and adorning appearances is the matter of ritual and music.

sentences.zh: 禮義立，則貴賤等矣；

translations.literal: If ritual and righteousness are established, then noble and base are equalized;
translations.idiomatic: If ritual and righteousness are established, then noble and base are equalized.

sentences.zh: 樂文同，則上下和矣；

translations.literal: If music's patterns are unified, then superiors and inferiors are harmonious;
translations.idiomatic: If music's patterns are unified, then superiors and inferiors are harmonious.

sentences.zh: 好惡著，則賢不肖別矣；

translations.literal: If likes and dislikes are manifest, then worthy and unworthy are distinguished;
translations.idiomatic: If likes and dislikes are manifest, then worthy and unworthy are distinguished.

sentences.zh: 刑禁暴，爵舉賢，則政均矣。

translations.literal: Punishment restrains violence, rank raises the worthy, then governance is even.
translations.idiomatic: Punishment restrains violence; rank raises the worthy; then governance is even.

sentences.zh: 仁以愛之，義以正之，如此則民治行矣。

translations.literal: Benevolence loves them, righteousness corrects them; thus then popular governance proceeds.
translations.idiomatic: Benevolence loves them; righteousness corrects them; thus then the popular governance proceeds.

translations.literal: Music is for sameness, ritual is for difference. Same then mutually intimate, different then mutually respectful. Music prevails then flows, ritual prevails then separates. Uniting feelings adorning appearance, is ritual music's affair. Ritual righteousness established, then noble base equal; Music culture same, then high low harmonize; Likes dislikes manifest, then worthy unworthy distinguished; Punishment prohibits violence, rank raises worthy, then governance even. Benevolence to love them, righteousness to correct them, thus then people governance flows.

sentences.zh: 樂由中出，禮自外作。

translations.literal: Music emerges from within, ritual is made from without.
translations.idiomatic: Music emerges from within; ritual is made from without.

sentences.zh: 樂由中出，故靜；

translations.literal: Music emerges from within, therefore tranquil;
translations.idiomatic: Music emerges from within, therefore tranquil.

sentences.zh: 禮自外作，故文。

translations.literal: Ritual is made from without, therefore patterned.
translations.idiomatic: Ritual is made from without, therefore patterned.

sentences.zh: 大樂必易，大禮必簡。

translations.literal: Great music must be easy, great ritual must be simple.
translations.idiomatic: Great music must be easy; great ritual must be simple.

sentences.zh: 樂至則無怨，禮至則不爭。

translations.literal: When music arrives then no resentment, when ritual arrives then no contention.
translations.idiomatic: When music arrives then no resentment; when ritual arrives then no contention.

sentences.zh: 揖讓而治天下者，禮樂之謂也。

translations.literal: Yielding and deferring to govern the world is what ritual and music are called.
translations.idiomatic: Yielding and deferring to govern the world is what ritual and music are called.

sentences.zh: 暴民不作，諸侯賓服，兵革不試，五刑不用，百姓無患，天子不怒，如此則樂達矣。

translations.literal: Violent people do not arise, feudal lords submit as guests, weapons are not tested, five punishments are not used, the people have no troubles, the Son of Heaven is not angry; thus then music is achieved.
translations.idiomatic: Violent people do not arise; feudal lords submit as guests; weapons are not tested; five punishments are not used; the people have no troubles; the Son of Heaven is not angry; thus then music is achieved.

sentences.zh: 合父子之親，明長幼之序，以敬四海之內。

translations.literal: Unite father-son intimacy, clarify elder-younger sequence, to respect within the four seas.
translations.idiomatic: Unite father-son intimacy; clarify elder-younger sequence; to respect within the four seas.

sentences.zh: 天子如此，則禮行矣。

translations.literal: If the Son of Heaven is thus, then ritual proceeds.
translations.idiomatic: If the Son of Heaven is thus, then ritual proceeds.

translations.literal: Music comes from within, ritual is made from without. Music comes from within, thus quiet; Ritual made from without, thus patterned. Great music must be easy, great ritual must be simple. Music reaches then no resentment, ritual reaches then no contention. Yielding and deferring to govern the world, this is called ritual music. Violent people do not arise, feudal lords submit as guests, weapons not tested, five punishments not used, hundred families without worry, Son of Heaven not angry, thus then music reaches completion. Unites father son closeness, clarifies elder younger order, to respect within the four seas. Son of Heaven thus, then ritual flows.

sentences.zh: 大樂與天地同和，大禮與天地同節。

translations.literal: Great music is harmonious with heaven and earth, great ritual is measured with heaven and earth.
translations.idiomatic: The great music is harmonious with heaven and earth; the great ritual is measured with heaven and earth.

sentences.zh: 和，故百物不失；

translations.literal: Harmonious, therefore the hundred things are not lost;
translations.idiomatic: Harmonious, therefore the hundred things are not lost.

sentences.zh: 節，故祀天祭地。

translations.literal: Measured, therefore sacrifice to heaven and earth.
translations.idiomatic: Measured, therefore sacrifice to heaven and earth.

sentences.zh: 明則有禮樂，幽則有鬼神，如此則四海之內合敬同愛矣。

translations.literal: In brightness there are ritual and music, in darkness there are ghosts and spirits; thus then within the four seas united respect and same love.
translations.idiomatic: In brightness there are ritual and music; in darkness there are ghosts and spirits; thus then within the four seas united respect and same love.

sentences.zh: 禮者，殊事合敬者也；

translations.literal: Ritual is that which in different matters unites respect;
translations.idiomatic: Ritual is that which in different matters unites respect.

sentences.zh: 樂者，異文合愛者也。

translations.literal: Music is that which in different patterns unites love.
translations.idiomatic: Music is that which in different patterns unites love.

sentences.zh: 禮樂之情同，故明王以相沿也。

translations.literal: Ritual and music's essence is the same, therefore enlightened kings have followed each other.
translations.idiomatic: Ritual and music's essence is the same; therefore enlightened kings have followed each other.

sentences.zh: 故事與時并，名與功偕。

translations.literal: Therefore affairs run parallel with time, names accompany merit.
translations.idiomatic: Therefore affairs run parallel with time; names accompany merit.

sentences.zh: 故鐘鼓管磬羽籥干戚，樂之器也；

translations.literal: Therefore bells, drums, pipes, chimes, feather flutes, shield-axes are music's instruments;
translations.idiomatic: Therefore bells, drums, pipes, chimes, feather flutes, shield-axes are music's instruments.

sentences.zh: 詘信俯仰級兆舒疾，樂之文也。

translations.literal: Bending, extending, bowing, raising, ranks, signs, leisurely, urgent are music's patterns.
translations.idiomatic: Bending, extending, bowing, raising, ranks, signs, leisurely, urgent are music's patterns.

sentences.zh: 簠簋俎豆制度文章，禮之器也；

translations.literal: Gui, yi, zu, dou institutions and patterns are ritual's instruments;
translations.idiomatic: Gui, yi, zu, dou institutions and patterns are ritual's instruments.

sentences.zh: 升降上下周旋裼襲，禮之文也。

translations.literal: Ascending, descending, above, below, circling, turning, exposing, covering are ritual's patterns.
translations.idiomatic: Ascending, descending, above, below, circling, turning, exposing, covering are ritual's patterns.

sentences.zh: 故知禮樂之情者能作，識禮樂之文者能術。

translations.literal: Therefore those who know ritual and music's essence can create, those who recognize ritual and music's patterns can explain.
translations.idiomatic: Therefore those who know the ritual and music essence can create; those who recognize the ritual and music patterns can explain.

sentences.zh: 作者之謂聖，術者之謂明。

translations.literal: Creators are called sages, explainers are called enlightened.
translations.idiomatic: Creators are called sages; explainers are called enlightened.

sentences.zh: 明聖者，術作之謂也。

translations.literal: Enlightened and sage are what explaining and creating are called.
translations.idiomatic: Enlightened and sage are what explaining and creating are called.

translations.literal: Great music with heaven earth same harmony, great ritual with heaven earth same measure. Harmony, thus hundred things not lost; Measure, thus sacrifice heaven worship earth. Bright then has ritual music, dark then has ghosts spirits, thus within four seas united respect same love. Ritual is different affairs united respect; Music is different patterns united love. Ritual music feelings same, thus enlightened kings mutually continue. Thus affairs with time together, name with merit accompany. Thus bells drums pipes chimes feathers yu shields axes, music's instruments; Bend stretch bow rise levels ranks spread hurry, music's patterns. Gui fu zu dou systems patterns, ritual's instruments; Ascend descend high low circle turn bare wear, ritual's patterns. Thus knowing ritual music feelings can create, recognizing ritual music patterns can explain. Creator called sage, explainer called enlightened. Enlightened sage is explainer creator called.

sentences.zh: 樂者，天地之和也；

translations.literal: Music is heaven and earth's harmony;
translations.idiomatic: Music is heaven and earth's harmony.

sentences.zh: 禮者，天地之序也。

translations.literal: Ritual is heaven and earth's order.
translations.idiomatic: Ritual is heaven and earth's order.

sentences.zh: 和，故百物皆化；

translations.literal: Harmonious, therefore the hundred things all transform;
translations.idiomatic: Harmonious, therefore the hundred things all transform.

sentences.zh: 序，故群物皆別。

translations.literal: Ordered, therefore the grouped things all distinguish.
translations.idiomatic: Ordered, therefore the grouped things all distinguish.

sentences.zh: 樂由天作，禮以地制。

translations.literal: Music is made by heaven, ritual is formulated by earth.
translations.idiomatic: Music is made by heaven; ritual is formulated by earth.

sentences.zh: 過制則亂，過作則暴。

translations.literal: Exceeding formulation then chaotic, exceeding making then tyrannical.
translations.idiomatic: Exceeding formulation then chaotic; exceeding making then tyrannical.

sentences.zh: 明於天地，然後能興禮樂也。

translations.literal: Enlightened about heaven and earth, then able to flourish ritual and music.
translations.idiomatic: Enlightened about heaven and earth, then able to flourish ritual and music.

sentences.zh: 論倫無患，樂之情也；

translations.literal: Discussing relationships without trouble, music's essence;
translations.idiomatic: Discussing relationships without trouble is music's essence.

sentences.zh: 欣喜驩愛，樂之（容）［官］也。

translations.literal: Joyful delight and love, music's appearance.
translations.idiomatic: Joyful delight and love are music's appearance.

sentences.zh: 中正無邪，禮之質也；

translations.literal: Central and upright without deviance, ritual's substance;
translations.idiomatic: Central and upright without deviance is ritual's substance.

sentences.zh: 莊敬恭順，禮之制也。

translations.literal: Solemn, respectful, reverent, obedient, ritual's formulation.
translations.idiomatic: Solemn, respectful, reverent, obedient are ritual's formulation.

sentences.zh: 若夫禮樂之施於金石，越於聲音，用於宗廟社稷，事于山川鬼神，則此所以與民同也。

translations.literal: As for ritual and music's application to metal and stone, transmission through sound and tone, use in ancestral temples and altars of soil and grain, service to mountains, rivers, ghosts, spirits; then this is what unites with the people.
translations.idiomatic: As for ritual and music's application to metal and stone, transmission through sound and tone, use in ancestral temples and altars of soil and grain, service to mountains, rivers, ghosts, spirits; then this is what unites with the people.

translations.literal: Music is heaven earth's harmony; Ritual is heaven earth's order. Harmony thus hundred things all transform; Order thus group things all distinguished. Music by heaven made, ritual by earth formed. Exceed formation then chaos, exceed making then violent. Clear about heaven earth, then can flourish ritual music. Discuss principles without worry, music's feeling; Joy happiness delight love, music's appearance. Central correct without evil, ritual's substance; Solemn respectful reverent yielding, ritual's system. As for ritual music's application to metal stone, surpasses sounds, used at ancestral temple earth altar, serves mountain rivers ghosts spirits, then this is to unite with people.

sentences.zh: 王者功成作樂，治定制禮。

translations.literal: Kings accomplish merit and make music, govern and establish ritual.
translations.idiomatic: Kings accomplish merit and make music; they govern and establish ritual.

sentences.zh: 其功大者其樂備，其治辨者其禮具。

translations.literal: Those whose merit is great have complete music, those whose governance is clear have complete ritual.
translations.idiomatic: Those whose merit is great have the complete music; those whose governance is clear have the complete ritual.

sentences.zh: 干戚之舞，非備樂也；

translations.literal: Shield-axe dancing is not complete music;
translations.idiomatic: Shield-axe dancing is not complete music.

sentences.zh: 亨孰而祀，非達禮也。

translations.literal: Offering cooked food and sacrificing is not penetrating ritual.
translations.idiomatic: Offering cooked food and sacrificing is not penetrating ritual.

sentences.zh: 五帝殊時，不相沿樂；

translations.literal: The Five Emperors had different times, did not follow each other's music;
translations.idiomatic: The Five Emperors had different times and did not follow each other's music.

sentences.zh: 三王異世，不相襲禮。

translations.literal: The Three Kings had different ages, did not copy each other's ritual.
translations.idiomatic: The Three Kings had different ages and did not copy each other's ritual.

sentences.zh: 樂極則憂，禮粗則偏矣。

translations.literal: Music to the extreme then sorrowful, ritual coarse then partial.
translations.idiomatic: Music to the extreme then sorrowful; ritual coarse then partial.

sentences.zh: 及夫敦樂而無憂，禮備而不偏者，其唯大聖乎？

translations.literal: As for those who cultivate music without sorrow, complete ritual without partiality; is it not only the great sages?
translations.idiomatic: As for those who cultivate music without sorrow and complete ritual without partiality, is it not only the great sages?

sentences.zh: 天高地下，萬物散殊，而禮制行也；

translations.literal: Heaven high earth low, ten thousand things scattered and different, and ritual regulation proceeds;
translations.idiomatic: Heaven is high and earth is low; the ten thousand things are scattered and different, and ritual regulation proceeds.

sentences.zh: 流而不息，合同而化，而樂興也。

translations.literal: Flowing without ceasing, uniting and transforming, and music arises.
translations.idiomatic: Flowing without ceasing, uniting and transforming, and music arises.

sentences.zh: 春作夏長，仁也；

translations.literal: Spring creates summer grows, benevolence;
translations.idiomatic: Spring creates and summer grows—this is benevolence.

sentences.zh: 秋斂冬藏，義也。

translations.literal: Autumn gathers winter stores, righteousness.
translations.idiomatic: Autumn gathers and winter stores—this is righteousness.

sentences.zh: 仁近於樂，義近於禮。

translations.literal: Benevolence approaches music, righteousness approaches ritual.
translations.idiomatic: Benevolence approaches music; righteousness approaches ritual.

sentences.zh: 樂者敦和，率神而從天；

translations.literal: Music cultivates harmony, leads the spirits and follows heaven;
translations.idiomatic: Music cultivates harmony; it leads the spirits and follows heaven.

sentences.zh: 禮者辨宜，居鬼而從地。

translations.literal: Ritual distinguishes appropriateness, resides with ghosts and follows earth.
translations.idiomatic: Ritual distinguishes appropriateness; it resides with ghosts and follows earth.

sentences.zh: 故聖人作樂以應天，作禮以配地。

translations.literal: Therefore sages make music to respond to heaven, make ritual to match earth.
translations.idiomatic: Therefore sages make music to respond to heaven and make ritual to match earth.

sentences.zh: 禮樂明備，天地官矣。

translations.literal: Ritual and music clearly complete, heaven and earth are governed.
translations.idiomatic: Ritual and music clearly complete—heaven and earth are governed.

translations.literal: Kings when merit complete make music, when governance settled establish ritual. Merit great then music complete, governance clear then ritual complete. Shield axe dance, not complete music; Cook sacrifice, not reach ritual. Five Emperors different times, not continue music; Three Kings different ages, not imitate ritual. Music extreme then worry, ritual crude then partial. Reach sincere music without worry, ritual complete without partial, its only great sage? Heaven high earth low, ten thousand things scattered different, ritual system carries; Flows without cease, unites contracts transforms, music arises. Spring makes summer grows, benevolence; Autumn gathers winter stores, righteousness. Benevolence close to music, righteousness close to ritual. Music sincere harmony, leads spirits follows heaven; Ritual distinguishes suitable, dwells ghosts follows earth. Thus sages make music to respond heaven, make ritual to match earth. Ritual music clear complete, heaven earth official.

sentences.zh: 天尊地卑，君臣定矣。

translations.literal: Heaven honored earth humble, ruler and minister established.
translations.idiomatic: Heaven is honored and earth is humble—ruler and minister are established.

sentences.zh: 高卑已陳，貴賤位矣。

translations.literal: High and low already arrayed, noble and base positioned.
translations.idiomatic: High and low are already arrayed; noble and base are positioned.

sentences.zh: 動靜有常，小大殊矣。

translations.literal: Movement and stillness have constancy, small and great differ.
translations.idiomatic: Movement and stillness have constancy; small and great differ.

sentences.zh: 方以類聚，物以群分，則性命不同矣。

translations.literal: Directions gather by kind, things divide by group, then natures and destinies differ.
translations.idiomatic: Directions gather by kind and things divide by group; then the natures and destinies differ.

sentences.zh: 在天成象，在地成形，如此則禮者天地之別也。

translations.literal: In heaven forms images, on earth forms shapes; thus then ritual is heaven and earth's distinction.
translations.idiomatic: In heaven it forms images; on earth it forms shapes. Thus, ritual is the heaven and earths distinction.

sentences.zh: 地氣上隮，天氣下降，陰陽相摩，天地相蕩，鼓之以雷霆，奮之以風雨，動之以四時，煖之以日月，而百［物］化興焉，如此則樂者天地之和也。

translations.literal: Earth qi ascends, heaven qi descends; yin and yang rub against each other; heaven and earth shake each other; drum with thunder; arouse with wind and rain; move with four seasons; warm with sun and moon; and the hundred things' transformations arise; thus then music is heaven and earth's harmony.
translations.idiomatic: Earth qi ascends and heaven qi descends; yin and yang rub against each other; heaven and earth shake each other. They drum with thunder; arouse with wind and rain; move with the four seasons; warm with sun and moon. And the hundred things' transformations arise. Thus, music is heaven and earth's harmony.

translations.literal: Heaven honored earth humble, ruler minister settled. High low already displayed, noble base positioned. Movement stillness have constant, small large different. Directions by kind gather, things by group divide, then life nature different. In heaven forms images, on earth forms shapes, thus ritual heaven earth's distinction. Earth qi ascends, heaven qi descends, yin yang mutually rub, heaven earth mutually surge, drums with thunder, rouses with wind rain, moves with four seasons, warms with sun moon, hundred things transform arise, thus music heaven earth's harmony.

sentences.zh: 化不時則不生，男女無別則亂登，此天地之情也。

translations.literal: Transformation not in season then does not give birth, male and female without distinction then chaotic union; this is heaven and earth's nature.
translations.idiomatic: If transformation is not in season, then it does not give birth; if male and female have no distinction, then chaotic union occurs. This is the heaven and earths nature.

sentences.zh: 及夫禮樂之極乎天而蟠乎地，行乎陰陽而通乎鬼神，窮高極遠而測深厚，樂著太始而禮居成物。

translations.literal: As for ritual and music's reaching heaven and coiling on earth, proceeding through yin and yang and communicating with ghosts and spirits, exhausting height and extreme distance and measuring depth and thickness; music attaches to the great beginning and ritual resides in completed things.
translations.idiomatic: As for ritual and music reaching heaven and coiling on earth, proceeding through yin and yang and communicating with ghosts and spirits, exhausting height and extreme distance and measuring depth and thickness: music attaches to the great beginning and ritual resides in completed things.

sentences.zh: 著不息者天也，著不動者地也。

translations.literal: What attaches without ceasing is heaven, what attaches without moving is earth.
translations.idiomatic: What attaches without ceasing is heaven; what attaches without moving is earth.

sentences.zh: 一動一靜者，天地之閒也。

translations.literal: One movement one stillness is heaven and earth's between.
translations.idiomatic: One movement, one stillness—this is heaven and earth's between.

sentences.zh: 故聖人曰「禮云樂云」。

translations.literal: Therefore the sage said 'Ritual says, music says.'
translations.idiomatic: Therefore the sage said: 'Ritual says, music says.'

translations.literal: Transform not timely then not born, male female no distinction then chaos ascends, this heaven earth's feelings. Reach ritual music's extreme heaven coil earth, walk yin yang connect ghosts spirits, exhaust high extreme far measure deep thick, music manifests great beginning ritual dwells completed things. Manifest not cease heaven, manifest not move earth. One move one still, heaven earth's between. Thus sages say 'ritual cloud music cloud'.

sentences.zh: 昔者舜作五弦之琴，以歌南風；

translations.literal: In former times Shun made a five-stringed zither, to sing the Southern Wind;
translations.idiomatic: In former times, Shun made a five-stringed zither to sing of the Southern Wind.

sentences.zh: 夔始作樂，以賞諸侯。

translations.literal: Kui began making music, to reward the feudal lords.
translations.idiomatic: Kui began making music to reward the feudal lords.

sentences.zh: 故天子之為樂也，以賞諸侯之有德者也。

translations.literal: Therefore the Son of Heaven's making music is to reward feudal lords who have virtue.
translations.idiomatic: Therefore, the Son of Heaven's making music is to reward feudal lords who have virtue.

sentences.zh: 德盛而教尊，五穀時孰，然後賞之以樂。

translations.literal: Virtue flourishes and teachings honored, five grains seasonably ripen, then reward with music.
translations.idiomatic: When virtue flourishes and teachings are honored, and the five grains ripen in season, then reward them with music.

sentences.zh: 故其治民勞者，其舞行級遠；

translations.literal: Therefore those who govern the people diligently, their dance steps are ranked far;
translations.idiomatic: Therefore, those who govern the people diligently have their dance steps ranked far.

sentences.zh: 其治民佚者，其舞行級短。

translations.literal: Those who govern the people at ease, their dance steps are ranked short.
translations.idiomatic: Those who govern the people at ease have their dance steps ranked short.

sentences.zh: 故觀其舞而知其德，聞其謚而知其行。

translations.literal: Therefore observe their dance and know their virtue, hear their posthumous name and know their conduct.
translations.idiomatic: Therefore observe the dance and know the virtue; hear the posthumous name and know the conduct.

sentences.zh: 大章，章之也；

translations.literal: Da Zhang, manifests it;
translations.idiomatic: Da Zhang manifests it.

sentences.zh: 咸池，備也；

translations.literal: Xian Chi, prepares it;
translations.idiomatic: Xian Chi prepares it.

sentences.zh: 韶，繼也；

translations.literal: Shao, continues it;
translations.idiomatic: Shao continues it.

sentences.zh: 夏，大也；

translations.literal: Xia, makes it great;
translations.idiomatic: Xia makes it great.

sentences.zh: 殷周之樂盡也。

translations.literal: Yin and Zhou's music exhausts it.
translations.idiomatic: Yin and Zhou's music exhausts it.

translations.literal: Former Shun made five string qin, to sing southern wind; Kui first made music, to reward feudal lords. Thus Son of Heaven makes music, to reward feudal lords who have virtue. Virtue flourishing teaching honored, five grains timely ripe, then reward with music. Thus govern people toil, their dance steps grade far; Govern people ease, their dance steps grade short. Thus observe dance know virtue, hear posthumous know conduct. Great Zhang, zhang it; Xian Chi, complete; Shao, continue; Xia, great; Yin Zhou music exhaust.

sentences.zh: 天地之道，寒暑不時則疾，風雨不節則饑。

translations.literal: Heaven and earth's way: cold and heat not in season then illness, wind and rain not measured then famine.
translations.idiomatic: The way of heaven and earth: if cold and heat are not in season, then illness occurs; if wind and rain are not measured, then famine occurs.

sentences.zh: 教者，民之寒暑也，教不時則傷世。

translations.literal: Teaching is the people's cold and heat, teaching not in season then harms the age.
translations.idiomatic: Teaching is the people's cold and heat; if teaching is not in season, then it harms the age.

sentences.zh: 事者，民之風雨也，事不節則無功。

translations.literal: Affairs are the people's wind and rain, affairs not measured then no merit.
translations.idiomatic: Affairs are the people's wind and rain; if affairs are not measured, then there is no merit.

sentences.zh: 然則先王之為樂也，以法治也，善則行象德矣。

translations.literal: Thus then the former kings' making music was to govern with law, goodness then conduct imitates virtue.
translations.idiomatic: Thus, the former kings' making music was to govern with law; when goodness occurs, then conduct imitates virtue.

sentences.zh: 夫豢豕為酒，非以為禍也；

translations.literal: Indeed raising pigs for wine is not to create calamity;
translations.idiomatic: Indeed, raising pigs for wine is not to create calamity.

sentences.zh: 而獄訟益煩，則酒之流生禍也。

translations.literal: But lawsuits increasingly numerous, then wine's indulgence gives birth to calamity.
translations.idiomatic: But if lawsuits become increasingly numerous, then wine's indulgence gives birth to calamity.

sentences.zh: 是故先王因為酒禮，一獻之禮，賓主百拜，終日飲酒而不得醉焉，此先王之所以備酒禍也。

translations.literal: Therefore the former kings established wine ritual, one offering ritual, guest and host hundred bows, all day drink wine but not become drunk; this is the former kings' preparation against wine calamity.
translations.idiomatic: Therefore the former kings established the wine ritual with one offering, where guest and host exchange a hundred bows and drink wine all day without becoming drunk. This is the former kings' preparation against wine calamity.

sentences.zh: 故酒食者，所以合歡也。

translations.literal: Therefore wine and food are what unite happiness.
translations.idiomatic: Therefore wine and food are what unite happiness.

translations.literal: Heaven earth's way, cold heat not timely then illness, wind rain not measure then famine. Teaching, people's cold heat, teaching not timely then harm age. Affairs, people's wind rain, affairs not measure then no merit. Thus then former kings make music, with law governs, good then conduct symbolizes virtue. Raise pigs for wine, not for calamity; But lawsuits increasingly frequent, then wine flow gives birth calamity. Thus former kings because wine ritual, one offering ritual, guest host hundred bows, end day drink wine not get drunk, this former kings prepare wine calamity. Thus wine food, to unite joy.

sentences.zh: 樂者，所以象德也；

translations.literal: Music is that which imitates virtue;
translations.idiomatic: Music is that which imitates virtue.

sentences.zh: 禮者，所以閉淫也。

translations.literal: Ritual is that which closes licentiousness.
translations.idiomatic: Ritual is that which closes licentiousness.

sentences.zh: 是故先王有大事，必有禮以哀之；

translations.literal: Therefore the former kings had great matters, must have ritual to mourn them;
translations.idiomatic: Therefore the former kings had great matters and must have ritual to mourn them.

sentences.zh: 有大福，必有禮以樂之：哀樂之分，皆以禮終。

translations.literal: Had great blessings, must have ritual to rejoice them: sorrow and joy's division, all end with ritual.
translations.idiomatic: Had great blessings and must have ritual to rejoice them: the division between sorrow and joy all ends with ritual.

translations.literal: Music, to symbolize virtue; Ritual, to close licentious. Thus former kings have great affairs, must have ritual to mourn them; Have great blessing, must have ritual to take joy in it: joy sorrow divisions, all with ritual end.

sentences.zh: 樂也者，施也；

translations.literal: Music is giving;
translations.idiomatic: Music is giving.

sentences.zh: 禮也者，報也。

translations.literal: Ritual is repaying.
translations.idiomatic: Ritual is repaying.

sentences.zh: 樂，樂其所自生；

translations.literal: Music takes joy in what gives birth to it;
translations.idiomatic: Music takes joy in what gives birth to it.

sentences.zh: 而禮，反其所自始。

translations.literal: And ritual returns to what began it.
translations.idiomatic: And ritual returns to what began it.

sentences.zh: 樂章德，禮報情反始也。

translations.literal: Music manifests virtue, ritual repays emotion and returns to beginnings.
translations.idiomatic: Music manifests virtue; ritual repays emotion and returns to beginnings.

sentences.zh: 所謂大路者，天子之輿也；

translations.literal: What is called the great chariot is the Son of Heaven's carriage;
translations.idiomatic: What is called the great chariot is the Son of Heaven's carriage.

sentences.zh: 龍旂九旒，天子之旌也；

translations.literal: Dragon banner nine streamers, Son of Heaven's standard;
translations.idiomatic: Dragon banner with nine streamers is the Son of Heaven's standard.

sentences.zh: 青黑緣者，天子之葆龜也；

translations.literal: Blue-black bordered is Son of Heaven's preserved turtle;
translations.idiomatic: The blue-black bordered one is the Son of Heaven's preserved turtle.

sentences.zh: 從之以牛羊之群，則所以贈諸侯也。

translations.literal: Followed by herds of cattle and sheep, then this is what gifts to feudal lords.
translations.idiomatic: Followed by herds of cattle and sheep, then this is what gifts to the feudal lords.

translations.literal: Music is giving; Ritual is receiving. Music, takes joy in what gives birth to it; Ritual returns to what begins it. Music displays virtue, ritual repays feeling returns to beginning. What is called great carriage, is the Son of Heaven's chariot; Dragon banner nine tassels, is the Son of Heaven's standard; Blue black edged, is the Son of Heaven's canopy turtle; Followed by herds of cattle sheep, then this is to gift feudal lords.

sentences.zh: 樂也者，情之不可變者也；

translations.literal: Music is emotion that cannot be changed;
translations.idiomatic: Music is emotion that cannot be changed.

sentences.zh: 禮也者，理之不可易者也。

translations.literal: Ritual is principle that cannot be altered.
translations.idiomatic: Ritual is principle that cannot be altered.

sentences.zh: 樂統同，禮別異，禮樂之說貫乎人情矣。

translations.literal: Music unifies sameness, ritual distinguishes difference; ritual and music's doctrine penetrates human emotion.
translations.idiomatic: Music unifies what is the same; ritual distinguishes what is different. Ritual and music's doctrine penetrates human emotion.

sentences.zh: 窮本知變，樂之情也；

translations.literal: Exhausting the root and knowing change, music's essence;
translations.idiomatic: Exhausting the root and knowing change is music's essence.

sentences.zh: 著誠去偽，禮之經也。

translations.literal: Manifesting sincerity and removing falsity, ritual's canon.
translations.idiomatic: Manifesting sincerity and removing falsity is ritual's canon.

sentences.zh: 禮樂順天地之誠，達神明之德，降興上下之神，而凝是精粗之體，領父子君臣之節。

translations.literal: Ritual and music follow heaven and earth's sincerity, reach the spirits' virtue, lower and raise the upper and lower spirits, and solidify this refined and coarse body, lead father-son ruler-minister relations.
translations.idiomatic: Ritual and music follow heaven and earth's sincerity, reach the spirits' virtue, lower and raise the upper and lower spirits, solidify this refined and coarse body, and lead father-son ruler-minister relations.

translations.literal: Music is feelings that cannot be changed; Ritual is principles that cannot be altered. Music unites sameness, ritual distinguishes difference, ritual music's explanation penetrates human feelings. Exhaust root know change, music's feeling; Manifest sincerity remove falsity, ritual's constant. Ritual music follows heaven earth's sincerity, reaches spirits' virtue, descends raises high low spirits, and congeals refined coarse bodies, leads father son ruler minister measures.

sentences.zh: 是故大人舉禮樂，則天地將為昭焉。

translations.literal: Therefore when great men raise ritual and music, then heaven and earth will be enlightened.
translations.idiomatic: Therefore when great men raise ritual and music, the heaven and earth will be enlightened.

sentences.zh: 天地欣合，陰陽相得，煦嫗覆育萬物，然後草木茂，區萌達，羽翮奮，角觡生，蟄蟲昭穌，羽者嫗伏，毛者孕鬻，胎生者不殰而卵生者不殈，則樂之道歸焉耳。

translations.literal: Heaven and earth joyfully unite, yin and yang mutually obtain; warm and nourish covering all things; then grasses and trees flourish, sprouts reach, winged ones soar, horned ones grow, hibernating insects become lively; feathered ones brood and nest, furred ones conceive and give birth, viviparous do not miscarry and oviparous do not break; then music's way returns there.
translations.idiomatic: The heaven and earth joyfully unite; yin and yang mutually obtain. They warm and nourish all things. Then grasses and trees flourish; sprouts reach; winged ones soar; horned ones grow; hibernating insects become lively. Feathered ones brood and nest; furred ones conceive and give birth. Viviparous do not miscarry and oviparous do not break. Then music way returns there.

translations.literal: Thus great person raises ritual music, then heaven earth will become bright. Heaven earth joyful unite, yin yang mutually obtain, warm nurture cover nourish ten thousand things, then grass trees flourish, regions sprout reach, feathered winged strive, horned tusked born, hibernating insects appear crawl, feathered warm brood, furred pregnant produce, womb born not abort egg born not break, then music's way returns there.

sentences.zh: 樂者，非謂黃鐘大呂弦歌干揚也，樂之末節也，故童者舞之；

translations.literal: Music is not speaking of yellow bell great lü string songs shield axe; music's final section; therefore children dance it;
translations.idiomatic: Music does not mean yellow bells, great lüs, string songs, or shield axes. These are the music final sections; therefore children dance them.

sentences.zh: 布筵席，陳樽俎，列籩豆，以升降為禮者，禮之末節也，故有司掌之。

translations.literal: Spread mats and seats, arrange goblets and stands, arrange baskets and bowls; taking ascending and descending as ritual; ritual's final section; therefore officials manage it.
translations.idiomatic: Spreading mats and seats, arranging goblets and stands, arranging baskets and bowls, taking ascending and descending as ritual—these are the ritual final sections; therefore officials manage them.

sentences.zh: 樂師辯乎聲詩，故北面而弦；

translations.literal: Music masters distinguish sound and poetry, therefore face north and play strings;
translations.idiomatic: Music masters distinguish sound and poetry; therefore they face north and play strings.

sentences.zh: 宗祝辯乎宗廟之禮，故後尸；

translations.literal: Ancestral invokers distinguish ancestral temple ritual, therefore follow the corpse;
translations.idiomatic: Ancestral invokers distinguish ancestral temple ritual; therefore they follow the corpse.

sentences.zh: 商祝辯乎喪禮，故後主人。

translations.literal: Funeral invokers distinguish funeral ritual, therefore follow the host.
translations.idiomatic: Funeral invokers distinguish funeral ritual; therefore they follow the host.

sentences.zh: 是故德成而上，藝成而下；

translations.literal: Therefore virtue completes and ascends, arts complete and descend;
translations.idiomatic: Therefore virtue completes and ascends; arts complete and descend.

sentences.zh: 行成而先，事成而後。

translations.literal: Conduct completes and comes first, affairs complete and come later.
translations.idiomatic: Conduct completes and comes first; affairs complete and come later.

sentences.zh: 是故先王有上有下，有先有後，然後可以有制於天下也。

translations.literal: Therefore the former kings had upper and lower, had first and last; then could have regulation over the world.
translations.idiomatic: Therefore the former kings had upper and lower, first and last; then they could have regulation over the world.

translations.literal: Music, not meaning yellow bell great lu string song shield axe, music's minor section, thus children dance it; Spread mats seats, arrange zun zu, arrange ban dou, with ascending descending as ritual, ritual's minor section, thus officials manage it. Music master distinguishes sounds poems, thus north facing strings; Ancestral priest distinguishes ancestral temple ritual, thus behind corpse; Funeral priest distinguishes mourning ritual, thus behind master. Thus virtue complete then above, skill complete then below; Conduct complete then first, affairs complete then after. Thus former kings have above below, have first after, then can have system over the world.

sentences.zh: 樂者，聖人之所樂也，而可以善民心。

translations.literal: Music is what sages take joy in, and can improve the people's hearts.
translations.idiomatic: Music is what sages take joy in, and it can improve the people's hearts.

sentences.zh: 其感人深，其風移俗易，故先王著其教焉。

translations.literal: Its moving people is deep, its wind shifts customs easily; therefore the former kings established their teachings.
translations.idiomatic: Its moving people is deep; its wind shifts customs easily. Therefore the former kings established their teachings.

translations.literal: Music is what sages take joy in, and can improve people's hearts. Its moving people deep, its wind shifts customs easy, thus former kings established its teaching.

sentences.zh: 夫人有血氣心知之性，而無哀樂喜怒之常，應感起物而動，然後心術形焉。

translations.literal: Indeed humans have blood qi heart knowing nature, but no constant of sorrow joy delight anger; responding to sensations arising from things and moving, then heart methods take form.
