translations.idiomatic: Indeed, humans have the nature of blood, qi, heart, and knowledge, but no constant of sorrow, joy, delight, or anger. Responding to sensations arising from things and moving, then the methods of the heart take form.

sentences.zh: 是故志微焦衰之音作，而民思憂；

translations.literal: Therefore when sounds of subtle anxious declining will arise, the people think sorrow;
translations.idiomatic: Therefore, when sounds of subtle, anxious, and declining arise, the people think sorrow.

sentences.zh: 啴緩慢易繁文簡節之音作，而民康樂；

translations.literal: When sounds of harmonious gentle slow easy ornate patterns simple sections arise, the people are peaceful and joyful;
translations.idiomatic: When sounds of harmonious, gentle, slow, easy, ornate patterns, and simple sections arise, the people are peaceful and joyful.

sentences.zh: 粗厲猛起奮末廣賁之音作，而民剛毅；

translations.literal: When sounds of coarse harsh fierce rising aroused endings broad splendor arise, the people are firm and resolute;
translations.idiomatic: When sounds of coarse, harsh, fierce, rising, aroused endings, and broad splendor arise, the people are firm and resolute.

sentences.zh: 廉直經正莊誠之音作，而民肅敬；

translations.literal: When sounds of upright straight canonical correct solemn sincere arise, the people are solemn and respectful;
translations.idiomatic: When sounds of upright, straight, canonical, correct, solemn, and sincere arise, the people are solemn and respectful.

sentences.zh: 寬裕肉好順成和動之音作，而民慈愛；

translations.literal: When sounds of generous ample fleshy good orderly accomplished harmonious moving arise, the people are benevolent and loving;
translations.idiomatic: When sounds of generous, ample, fleshy, good, orderly, accomplished, harmonious, and moving arise, the people are benevolent and loving.

sentences.zh: 流辟邪散狄成滌濫之音作，而民淫亂。

translations.literal: When sounds of licentious deviant heretical dispersed barbaric accomplished washed overflowing arise, the people are licentious and chaotic.
translations.idiomatic: When sounds of licentious, deviant, heretical, dispersed, barbaric, accomplished, washed, and overflowing arise, the people are licentious and chaotic.

translations.literal: People have blood qi heart knowing nature, but no joy sorrow happiness anger constants, respond to stimulation arise from things and move, then heart methods take form. Thus subtle withered declining sounds made, and people think worry; Smooth slow easy elaborate patterned simple sectioned sounds made, and people peaceful joyful; Coarse fierce violent rising striving end broad flourishing sounds made, and people firm resolute; Pure straight upright correct solemn sincere sounds made, and people solemn respectful; Broad ample fleshy good yielding formed harmonious moving sounds made, and people benevolent loving; Flowing deviant evil scattered foreign formed washed overflowing sounds made, and people licentious chaotic.

sentences.zh: 是故先王本之情性，稽之度數，制之禮義，合生氣之和，道五常之行，使之陽而不散，陰而不密，剛氣不怒，柔氣不懾，四暢交於中而發作於外，皆安其位而不相奪也。

translations.literal: Therefore the former kings based them on emotional nature, checked them against measures and numbers, controlled them with ritual and righteousness, united the living qi harmony, guided the five constants' conduct; made them yang but not scattered, yin but not secretive, strong qi not angry, soft qi not frightened; four flows intersect in the center and erupt outside; all settle in their positions and do not mutually usurp.
translations.idiomatic: Therefore the former kings based them on emotional nature, checked them against measures and numbers, controlled them with ritual and righteousness, united the living qi harmony, and guided the five constants' conduct. They made them yang but not scattered, yin but not secretive, strong qi not angry, soft qi not frightened. The four flows intersect in the center and erupt outside. All settle in their positions and do not mutually usurp.

sentences.zh: 然後立之學等，廣其節奏，省其文采，以繩德厚也。

translations.literal: Then established their learning ranks, broadened their rhythms, simplified their patterns and colors, to bind virtue thickly.
translations.idiomatic: Then they established the learning ranks, broadened the rhythms, simplified the patterns and colors, to bind virtue thickly.

sentences.zh: 類小大之稱，比終始之序，以象事行，使親疏貴賤長幼男女之理皆形見於樂：故曰「樂觀其深矣」。

translations.literal: Categorized small and great appellations, compared beginning and end sequences, to imitate affairs and conduct; made close and distant noble and base elder and young male and female principles all visibly appear in music: therefore it is said 'Music observes its depth.'
translations.idiomatic: They categorized the small and great appellations, compared the beginning and end sequences, to imitate affairs and conduct. They made the close and distant, noble and base, elder and young, male and female principles all visibly appear in music. Therefore it is said: Music observes its depth.

translations.literal: Thus former kings based on feelings nature, examined measurements numbers, formed ritual righteousness, united vital energy harmony, guided five constants conduct, made yang without scattering, yin without dense, firm qi not angry, soft qi not frightened, four flourishing intersect at center and issue at outside, all settle their positions without mutually seizing. Then established study grades, broadened rhythm, simplified patterns colors, to rope virtue thickness. Classify small large proportions, compare end beginning order, to symbolize affairs conduct, make close distant noble base elder younger male female principles all appear in music: thus said 'music observe its deep'.

sentences.zh: 土敝則草木不長，水煩則魚鱉不大，氣衰則生物不育，世亂則禮廢而樂淫。

translations.literal: When soil is exhausted then grasses and trees do not grow, when water is troubled then fish and turtles do not grow large, when qi declines then living things are not nurtured, when the age is chaotic then ritual is abandoned and music becomes licentious.
translations.idiomatic: When soil is exhausted, then grasses and trees do not grow. When water is troubled, then fish and turtles do not grow large. When qi declines, then living things are not nurtured. When the age is chaotic, then ritual is abandoned and music becomes licentious.

sentences.zh: 是故其聲哀而不莊，樂而不安，慢易以犯節，流湎以忘本。

translations.literal: Therefore its sound is sorrowful but not solemn, joyful but not peaceful, lax and easy to violate measure, licentious and dissipated to forget the root.
translations.idiomatic: Therefore its sound is sorrowful but not solemn, joyful but not peaceful, lax and easy so as to violate measure, licentious and dissipated so as to forget the root.

sentences.zh: 廣則容姦。

translations.literal: Broad then accommodates wickedness.
translations.idiomatic: Broad then accommodates wickedness.

sentences.zh: 狹則思欲，感滌蕩之氣而滅平和之德，是以君子賤之也。

translations.literal: Narrow then thinks of desires, moved by washed away dissipating qi and extinguishes peaceful virtue; therefore gentlemen despise it.
translations.idiomatic: Narrow then thinks of desires, moved by washed-away dissipating qi and extinguishes peaceful virtue. Therefore the gentlemen despise it.

translations.literal: Soil exhausted then grass trees not grow, water troubled then fish turtles not big, qi declined then living things not nurture, age chaotic then ritual waste and music licentious. Thus its sounds mournful without solemnity, joyful without peace, casual easy to violate sections, flowing drowning to forget root. Broad then contains evil. Narrow then desires, affected by washed wandering qi and extinguish peaceful virtue, thus gentlemen despise it.

sentences.zh: 凡姦聲感人而逆氣應之，逆氣成象而淫樂興焉。

translations.literal: All wicked sounds move people and perverse qi responds to them, perverse qi forms images and licentious music arises there.
translations.idiomatic: All wicked sounds move people and perverse qi responds to them; perverse qi forms images and the licentious music arises there.

sentences.zh: 正聲感人而順氣應之，順氣成象而和樂興焉。

translations.literal: Correct sounds move people and compliant qi responds to them, compliant qi forms images and harmonious music arises there.
translations.idiomatic: Correct sounds move people and compliant qi responds to them; compliant qi forms images and the harmonious music arises there.

sentences.zh: 倡和有應，回邪曲直各歸其分，而萬物之理以類相動也。

translations.literal: Leading and following have response, returning deviant curved straight each return to their portion, and ten thousand things' principle move each other by kind.
translations.idiomatic: Leading and following have response; returning deviant, curved, straight each return to their portion. And the ten thousand things principle move each other by kind.

translations.literal: All evil sounds move people and adverse qi respond to them, adverse qi forms images and licentious music arises. Correct sounds move people and yielding qi respond to them, yielding qi forms images and harmonious music arises. Leader harmony have response, returning deviant curved straight each return to their division, and ten thousand things principle with kind mutually move.

sentences.zh: 是故君子反情以和其志，比類以成其行。

translations.literal: Therefore gentlemen return to emotion to harmonize their will, compare kinds to complete their conduct.
translations.idiomatic: Therefore the gentlemen return to emotion to harmonize their will; they compare kinds to complete their conduct.

sentences.zh: 姦聲亂色不留聰明，淫樂廢禮不接於心術，惰慢邪辟之氣不設於身體，使耳目鼻口心知百體皆由順正，以行其義。

translations.literal: Wicked sounds chaotic colors do not detain intelligence, licentious music abandons ritual does not connect to heart methods, lazy lax heretical deviant qi not established in the body; make ears eyes nose mouth heart knowing hundred bodies all follow orderly correctness, to carry out their righteousness.
translations.idiomatic: Wicked sounds and chaotic colors do not detain intelligence; licentious music abandons ritual and does not connect to heart methods; lazy, lax, heretical, deviant qi is not established in the body. Make ears, eyes, nose, mouth, heart, knowing, and hundred bodies all follow orderly correctness, to carry out their righteousness.

sentences.zh: 然後發以聲音，文以琴瑟，動以干戚，飾以羽旄，從以簫管，奮至德之光，動四氣之和，以著萬物之理。

translations.literal: Then express with sound and tone, pattern with zither and se, move with shield and axe, adorn with feather banners, follow with flute pipes; arouse supreme virtue's light, move four qi harmony, to manifest ten thousand things' principle.
translations.idiomatic: Then express with sound and tone, pattern with zither and se, move with shield and axe, adorn with feather banners, follow with flute pipes. Arouse the supreme virtue light; move the four qi harmony; to manifest the ten thousand things principle.

sentences.zh: 是故清明象天，廣大象地，終始象四時，周旋象風雨；

translations.literal: Therefore clear brightness imitates heaven, vast greatness imitates earth, beginning and end imitate four seasons, circling imitates wind and rain;
translations.idiomatic: Therefore clear brightness imitates heaven; vast greatness imitates earth; beginning and end imitate the four seasons; circling imitates wind and rain.

sentences.zh: 五色成文而不亂，八風從律而不姦，百度得數而有常；

translations.literal: Five colors form patterns and are not chaotic, eight winds follow laws and are not wicked, hundred measures obtain numbers and have constancy;
translations.idiomatic: The five colors form patterns and are not chaotic; the eight winds follow laws and are not wicked; the hundred measures obtain numbers and have constancy.

sentences.zh: 小大相成，終始相生，倡和清濁，代相為經。

translations.literal: Small and great mutually complete, beginning and end mutually give birth, leading following clear turbid, alternating become canons.
translations.idiomatic: Small and great mutually complete; beginning and end mutually give birth; leading, following, clear, turbid alternating become the canons.

sentences.zh: 故樂行而倫清，耳目聰明，血氣和平，移風易俗，天下皆寧。

translations.literal: Therefore when music proceeds relationships are clear, ears and eyes intelligent, blood qi peaceful, shift winds change customs, all under heaven peaceful.
translations.idiomatic: Therefore when music proceeds, the relationships are clear; the ears and eyes are intelligent; the blood qi is peaceful; the winds are shifted and customs changed; all under heaven is peaceful.

sentences.zh: 故曰「樂者樂也」。

translations.literal: Therefore it is said 'Music is joy.'
translations.idiomatic: Therefore it is said: 'Music is joy.'

sentences.zh: 君子樂得其道，小人樂得其欲。

translations.literal: Gentlemen take joy in obtaining their way, small people take joy in obtaining their desires.
translations.idiomatic: Gentlemen take joy in obtaining their way; small people take joy in obtaining their desires.

sentences.zh: 以道制欲，則樂而不亂；

translations.literal: Using way to control desires, then joyful but not chaotic;
translations.idiomatic: Using the way to control desires, then joyful but not chaotic.

sentences.zh: 以欲忘道，則惑而不樂。

translations.literal: Using desires to forget way, then confused and not joyful.
translations.idiomatic: Using desires to forget the way, then confused and not joyful.

sentences.zh: 是故君子反情以和其志，廣樂以成其教，樂行而民鄉方，可以觀德矣。

translations.literal: Therefore gentlemen return to emotion to harmonize their will, broaden music to complete their teachings; when music proceeds and people face the square, virtue can be observed.
translations.idiomatic: Therefore gentlemen return to emotion to harmonize their will and broaden music to complete their teachings. When music proceeds and people face the square, virtue can be observed.

translations.literal: Thus gentleman returns to feeling to harmonize will, compares kinds to complete conduct. Evil sounds chaotic colors not stay intelligence, licentious music wastes ritual not connect to heart methods, lazy slow deviant crooked qi not placed in body, make ears eyes nose mouth heart knowing hundred bodies all follow upright correct, to carry out their righteousness. Then issue with sounds, pattern with qin se, move with shield axe, adorn with feather banners, follow with xiao pipes, strive utmost virtue light, move four qi harmony, to manifest ten thousand things principle. Thus clear bright symbolizes heaven, vast symbolizes earth, end beginning symbolizes four seasons, circling symbolizes wind rain; Five colors form pattern without chaos, eight winds follow pitch without evil, hundred measures obtain number have constant; Small large mutually complete, end beginning mutually born, lead harmony clear turbid, alternate mutually as warp. Thus music carries principles clear, ears eyes intelligent, blood qi peaceful, shift customs change habits, world all peaceful. Thus said 'music joy'. Gentleman joy gets way, small person joy gets desires. With way control desires, then joy without chaos; With desires forget way, then confused without joy. Thus gentleman returns to feeling harmonize will, broadens joy completes teaching, music carries people turn to square, can observe virtue.

sentences.zh: 德者，性之端也；

translations.literal: Virtue is nature's beginning;
translations.idiomatic: Virtue is nature's beginning.

sentences.zh: 樂者，德之華也；

translations.literal: Music is virtue's splendor;
translations.idiomatic: Music is virtue's splendor.

sentences.zh: 金石絲竹，樂之器也。

translations.literal: Metal stone silk bamboo, music's instruments.
translations.idiomatic: Metal, stone, silk, bamboo—these are music's instruments.

sentences.zh: 詩，言其志也；

translations.literal: Poetry speaks its will;
translations.idiomatic: Poetry speaks its will.

sentences.zh: 歌，詠其聲也；

translations.literal: Song chants its sound;
translations.idiomatic: Song chants its sound.

sentences.zh: 舞，動其容也：三者本乎心，然後樂氣從之。

translations.literal: Dance moves its appearance: three originate from heart, then music qi follows them.
translations.idiomatic: Dance moves its appearance. The three originate from the heart; then music qi follows them.

sentences.zh: 是故情深而文明，氣盛而化神，和順積中而英華發外，唯樂不可以為偽。

translations.literal: Therefore emotion deep and culture bright, qi abundant and transforms spirit, harmony obedience accumulates within and splendor radiates outside; only music cannot be faked.
translations.idiomatic: Therefore the emotion is deep and the culture is bright; the qi is abundant and transforms spirit; the harmony and obedience accumulate within and the splendor radiates outside. Only music cannot be faked.

translations.literal: Virtue, nature's beginning; Music, virtue's flower; Metal stone silk bamboo, music's instruments. Poem, speaks will; Song, chants sound; Dance, moves appearance: three from heart, then music qi follows. Thus feelings deep civilized bright, qi flourishing transforms divine, harmonious yielding accumulates center brilliant flower issues outside, only music cannot be false.

sentences.zh: 樂者，心之動也；

translations.literal: Music is heart's movement;
translations.idiomatic: Music is the heart's movement.

sentences.zh: 聲者，樂之象也；

translations.literal: Sound is music's image;
translations.idiomatic: Sound is music's image.

sentences.zh: 文采節奏，聲之飾也。

translations.literal: Patterns colors rhythms, sound's adornments.
translations.idiomatic: Patterns, colors, rhythms—these are sound's adornments.

sentences.zh: 君子動其本，樂其象，然後治其飾。

translations.literal: Gentlemen move their root, take joy in their image, then govern their adornments.
translations.idiomatic: The gentlemen move their root and take joy in their image; then they govern their adornments.

sentences.zh: 是故先鼓以警戒，三步以見方，再始以著往，復亂以飭歸，奮疾而不拔，（也）極幽而不隱。

translations.literal: Therefore first drum to alert and caution, three steps to show the square, twice begin to manifest going forth, again chaotic to arrange returning; aroused urgent but not uprooted, extreme hidden but not concealed.
translations.idiomatic: Therefore first drum to alert and caution; three steps to show the square; twice begin to manifest going forth; again chaotic to arrange returning. Aroused urgent but not uprooted; extreme hidden but not concealed.

sentences.zh: 獨樂其志，不厭其道；

translations.literal: Alone take joy in its will, not sated with its way;
translations.idiomatic: Alone take joy in its will; not sated with its way.

sentences.zh: 備舉其道，不私其欲。

translations.literal: Fully raise its way, not privatize its desires.
translations.idiomatic: Fully raise its way; do not privatize its desires.

sentences.zh: 是以情見而義立，樂終而德尊；

translations.literal: Therefore emotion appears and righteousness established, music ends and virtue honored;
translations.idiomatic: Therefore emotion appears and righteousness is established; music ends and virtue is honored.

sentences.zh: 君子以好善，小人以息過：故曰「生民之道，樂為大焉」。

translations.literal: Gentlemen use it to love goodness, small people use it to rest from faults: therefore it is said 'The way of nurturing the people, music is greatest.'
translations.idiomatic: Gentlemen use it to love goodness; small people use it to rest from faults. Therefore it is said: 'The way of nurturing the people—music is greatest.'

translations.literal: Music, heart's movement; Sound, music's image; Patterns colors rhythms, sound's ornament. Gentleman moves root, enjoys image, then governs ornament. Thus first drum to warn guard, three steps to show square, twice begin to manifest going, return chaos to arrange return, rouse quick without pull, extreme dark without hide. Alone joy will, not weary way; Complete raise way, not private desires. Thus feelings appear righteousness established, music ends virtue honored; Gentleman with love good, small person with cease faults: thus said 'born people way, music great'.

sentences.zh: 君子曰：禮樂不可以斯須去身。

translations.literal: The gentleman says: Ritual and music cannot be separated from the body for a moment.
translations.idiomatic: The gentleman says: 'Ritual and music cannot be separated from the body for a moment.'

sentences.zh: 致樂以治心，則易直子諒之心油然生矣。

translations.literal: Apply music to govern the heart, then easy upright filial sincere hearts naturally arise.
translations.idiomatic: Apply music to govern the heart, then easy, upright, filial, sincere hearts naturally arise.

sentences.zh: 易直子諒之心生則樂，樂則安，安則久，久則天，天則神。

translations.literal: Easy upright filial sincere hearts arise then joyful, joyful then peaceful, peaceful then lasting, lasting then heavenly, heavenly then spiritual.
translations.idiomatic: The easy, upright, filial, sincere hearts arise then joyful; joyful then peaceful; peaceful then lasting; lasting then heavenly; heavenly then spiritual.

sentences.zh: 天則不言而信，神則不怒而威。

translations.literal: Heavenly then speaks not but trusted, spiritual then angers not but awesome.
translations.idiomatic: Heavenly then speaks not but is trusted; spiritual then angers not but is awesome.

sentences.zh: 致樂，以治心者也；

translations.literal: Apply music is to govern the heart;
translations.idiomatic: Apply music is to govern the heart.

sentences.zh: 致禮，以治躬者也。

translations.literal: Apply ritual is to govern the person.
translations.idiomatic: Apply ritual is to govern the person.

sentences.zh: 治躬則莊敬，莊敬則嚴威。

translations.literal: Govern the person then solemn respectful, solemn respectful then stern awesome.
translations.idiomatic: Govern the person then solemn and respectful; solemn and respectful then stern and awesome.

sentences.zh: 心中斯須不和不樂，而鄙詐之心入之矣；

translations.literal: In the heart for a moment not harmonious not joyful, and vulgar deceitful hearts enter it;
translations.idiomatic: In the heart, for a moment not harmonious and not joyful, vulgar and deceitful hearts enter it.

sentences.zh: 外貌斯須不莊不敬，而慢易之心入之矣。

translations.literal: External appearance for a moment not solemn not respectful, and lax easy hearts enter it.
translations.idiomatic: External appearance for a moment not solemn and not respectful, and lax, easy hearts enter it.

sentences.zh: 故樂也者，動於內者也；

translations.literal: Therefore music is that which moves within;
translations.idiomatic: Therefore music is that which moves within.

sentences.zh: 禮也者，動於外者也。

translations.literal: Ritual is that which moves without.
translations.idiomatic: Ritual is that which moves without.

sentences.zh: 樂極和，禮極順。

translations.literal: Music reaches harmony, ritual reaches obedience.
translations.idiomatic: Music reaches harmony; ritual reaches obedience.

sentences.zh: 內和而外順，則民瞻其顏色而弗與爭也，望其容貌而民不生易慢焉。

translations.literal: Internally harmonious and externally obedient, then the people gaze at their complexion and do not contend with them, look at their appearance and the people do not give rise to easy laxity.
translations.idiomatic: Internally harmonious and externally obedient, then the people gaze at their complexion and do not contend with them; look at their appearance and the people do not give rise to easy laxity.

sentences.zh: 德煇動乎內而民莫不承聽，理發乎外而民莫不承順，故曰「知禮樂之道，舉而錯之天下無難矣」。

translations.literal: Virtue radiance moves within and the people none do not accept and listen, principle manifests without and the people none do not accept and follow; therefore it is said 'Know ritual and music's way, raise and place it in the world without difficulty.'
translations.idiomatic: Virtue radiance moves within and the people none do not accept and listen; principle manifests without and the people none do not accept and follow. Therefore it is said: 'Know ritual and music's way—raise and place it in the world without difficulty.'

translations.literal: Gentleman says: ritual music cannot moment leave body. Reach music to govern heart, then easy straight filial sincere heart naturally born. Easy straight filial sincere heart born then joy, joy then peaceful, peaceful then long, long then heaven, heaven then divine. Heaven then not speak trustworthy, divine then not angry awe. Reach music, to govern heart; Reach ritual, to govern person. Govern person then solemn respectful, solemn respectful then strict awe. Heart moment not harmonious not joyful, base deceit heart enters; Outside appearance moment not solemn not respectful, lazy easy heart enters. Thus music, moves within; Ritual, moves without. Music extreme harmony, ritual extreme yielding. Inner harmony outer yielding, then people gaze face not contend, look appearance people not born easy lazy. Virtue splendor moves within people none not receive hear, principle issues without people none not receive follow, thus said 'know ritual music way, raise place world no difficulty'.

sentences.zh: 樂也者，動於內者也；

translations.literal: Music is that which moves within;

sentences.zh: 禮也者，動於外者也。

translations.literal: Ritual is that which moves without.

sentences.zh: 故禮主其謙，樂主其盈。

translations.literal: Therefore ritual masters its modesty, music masters its fullness.

sentences.zh: 禮謙而進，以進為文；

translations.literal: Ritual modest and advances, takes advancing as pattern;

sentences.zh: 樂盈而反，以反為文。

translations.literal: Music full and returns, takes returning as pattern.

sentences.zh: 禮謙而不進，則銷；

translations.literal: Ritual modest but does not advance, then diminishes;

sentences.zh: 樂盈而不反，則放。

translations.literal: Music full but does not return, then dissolute.

sentences.zh: 故禮有報而樂有反。

translations.literal: Therefore ritual has repayment and music has return.

sentences.zh: 禮得其報則樂，樂得其反則安。

translations.literal: Ritual obtains its repayment then joyful, music obtains its return then peaceful.

sentences.zh: 禮之報，樂之反，其義一也。

translations.literal: Ritual's repayment, music's return, their meaning is one.

Music, moves within; Ritual, moves without. Thus ritual masters humility, music masters fullness. Ritual humble advances, with advance as pattern; Music full returns, with return as pattern. Ritual humble not advance, then disappears; Music full not return, then abandons. Thus ritual has repay music has return. Ritual gets repay then joy, music gets return then peaceful. Ritual's repay, music's return, meaning one.

sentences.zh: 夫樂者樂也，人情之所不能免也。

translations.literal: Indeed music is joy, human emotion's that which cannot be avoided.

sentences.zh: 樂必發諸聲音，形於動靜，人道也。

translations.literal: Music must express through sound and tone, take form in movement and stillness; human way.

sentences.zh: 聲音動靜，性術之變，盡於此矣。

translations.literal: Sound and tone, movement and stillness; nature and method's changes, exhaust here.

sentences.zh: 故人不能無樂，樂不能無形。

translations.literal: Therefore humans cannot lack music, music cannot lack form.

sentences.zh: 形而不為道，不能無亂。

translations.literal: Form but not guided by way, cannot lack chaos.

sentences.zh: 先王惡其亂，故制雅頌之聲以道之，使其聲足以樂而不流，使其文足以綸而不息，使其曲直繁省廉肉節奏，足以感動人之善心而已矣，不使放心邪氣得接焉，是先王立樂之方也。

translations.literal: Former kings hated its chaos, therefore established ya and song sounds to guide it; made their sound sufficient for joy but not licentious; made their patterns sufficient to bind but not weary; made their curved straight, ornate simple, upright fleshy rhythms sufficient to move people's good hearts only; did not let dissolute heretical qi connect there; this is former kings' establishment of music's method.

sentences.zh: 是故樂在宗廟之中，君臣上下同聽之，則莫不和敬；

translations.literal: Therefore music in ancestral temple within, ruler and ministers superiors and inferiors together listen to it, then none not harmonious and respectful;

sentences.zh: 在族長鄉里之中，長幼同聽之，則莫不和順；

translations.literal: In clan leaders neighborhood within, elders and young together listen to it, then none not harmonious and obedient;

sentences.zh: 在閨門之內，父子兄弟同聽之，則莫不和親。

translations.literal: In inner chambers within, father son brothers together listen to it, then none not harmonious and intimate.

sentences.zh: 故樂者，審一以定和，比物以飾節，節奏合以成文，所以合和父子君臣，附親萬民也，是先王立樂之方也。

translations.literal: Therefore music: examines unity to establish harmony, compares things to adorn measure, rhythms combine to form patterns; thus unites and harmonizes father-son ruler-minister, attaches and intimates myriad people; this is former kings' establishment of music's method.

translations.literal: Those who are gentle and can decide should sing the Qi.

sentences.zh: 夫歌者，直己而陳德；

translations.literal: Indeed singers express themselves and display virtue;

sentences.zh: 動己而天地應焉，四時和焉，星辰理焉，萬物育焉。

translations.literal: Move oneself and heaven and earth respond, four seasons harmonize, stars and planets order themselves, ten thousand things are nurtured.

sentences.zh: 故商者，五帝之遺聲也，商人志之，故謂之商；

translations.literal: Therefore Shang is the Five Emperors' remaining sound, Shang people cherished it, therefore called it Shang;

sentences.zh: 齊者，三代之遺聲也，齊人志之，故謂之齊。

translations.literal: Qi is the Three Dynasties' remaining sound, Qi people cherished it, therefore called it Qi.

sentences.zh: 明乎商之詩者，臨事而屢斷；

translations.literal: Those who understand Shang's poetry, when facing affairs repeatedly decide;

sentences.zh: 明乎齊之詩者，見利而讓也。

translations.literal: Those who understand Qi's poetry, when seeing profit yield.

sentences.zh: 臨事而屢斷，勇也；

translations.literal: Facing affairs and repeatedly deciding, courage;

sentences.zh: 見利而讓，義也。

translations.literal: Seeing profit and yielding, righteousness.

sentences.zh: 有勇有義，非歌孰能保此？

translations.literal: Having courage and righteousness, not songs who can preserve this?

sentences.zh: 故歌者，上如抗，下如隊，曲如折，止如槁木，居中矩，句中鉤，累累乎殷如貫珠。

translations.literal: Therefore singers: rising like resisting, falling like following, curving like breaking, stopping like withered wood, dwelling in center like square, in phrases like hooks, densely abundant like strung pearls.

sentences.zh: 故歌之為言也，長言之也。

translations.literal: Therefore song's being called yan, lengthens yan.

sentences.zh: 說之，故言之；

translations.literal: Pleases it, therefore speaks it;

sentences.zh: 言之不足，故長言之；

translations.literal: Speaking insufficient, therefore lengthens speaking;

sentences.zh: 長言之不足，故嗟嘆之；

translations.literal: Lengthened speaking insufficient, therefore sighs it;

sentences.zh: 嗟嘆之不足，故不知手之舞之足之蹈之。」

translations.literal: Sighing insufficient, therefore unknowingly hands dance it feet tread it.'

sentences.zh: 子貢問樂。

translations.literal: Zi Gong asked about music.

Shi Yi said: 'Yi, lowly artisan, how sufficient to ask suitable. Please recite what heard, my son yourself decide. Broad calm, soft correct suitable sing song; Vast calm, open penetrating trustworthy suitable sing great ya; Respectful frugal love ritual suitable sing small ya; Upright pure humble suitable sing wind; Unrestrained straight benevolent loving suitable sing shang; Warm good able decide suitable sing qi. Song, straight self display virtue; Move self heaven earth respond, four seasons harmonize, stars ordered, ten thousand things nurture. Thus shang, five emperors' remaining sound, Shang people recorded it, thus called shang; Qi, three dynasties' remaining sound, Qi people recorded it, thus called qi. Clear shang poems, face affairs repeatedly decide; Clear qi poems, see benefit yield. Face affairs repeatedly decide, brave; See benefit yield, righteous. Have brave have righteous, not song who can preserve this? Thus song as words, up like resist, down like troop, curved like break, stop like withered wood, reside middle square, phrase middle hook, continuous like abundant string pearls. Thus song as words, long speak it. Delight, thus speak; Speak insufficient, thus long speak; Long speak insufficient, thus sigh lament; Sigh lament insufficient, thus not know hand dance foot tread.' Zi Gong asked music.

sentences.zh: 凡音由於人心，天之與人有以相通，如景之象形，響之應聲。

translations.literal: All sound arises from the human heart, heaven and humans have means to communicate, like shadow's imitating form, echo's responding to sound.

sentences.zh: 故為善者天報之以福，為惡者天與之以殃，其自然者也。

translations.literal: Therefore those who do good heaven repays with blessings, those who do evil heaven gives calamity, it is natural.
All sound from human heart, heaven people have connect, like shadow image shape, echo respond sound. Thus do good heaven repays blessing, do evil heaven gives calamity, natural.

sentences.zh: 故舜彈五弦之琴，歌南風之詩而天下治；

translations.literal: Therefore Shun played five-stringed zither, sang Southern Wind poem and all under heaven was governed;

sentences.zh: 紂為朝歌北鄙之音，身死國亡。

translations.literal: Zhou made Zhao Ge northern rustic sounds, body died state perished.

sentences.zh: 舜之道何弘也？

translations.literal: Shun's way how broad?

sentences.zh: 紂之道何隘也？

translations.literal: Zhou's way how narrow?

sentences.zh: 夫南風之詩者生長之音也，舜樂好之，樂與天地同意，得萬國之驩心，故天下治也。

translations.literal: Indeed Southern Wind poem is growth sound, Shun took joy and liked it, joy united with heaven and earth's intent, obtained ten thousand states' happy hearts, therefore all under heaven governed.

sentences.zh: 夫朝歌者不時也，北者敗也，鄙者陋也，紂樂好之，與萬國殊心，諸侯不附，百姓不親，天下畔之，故身死國亡。

translations.literal: Indeed Zhao Ge is unseasonable, northern is defeated, rustic is vulgar; Zhou took joy and liked it, with ten thousand states different hearts, feudal lords did not attach, common people not intimate, all under heaven rebelled against him, therefore body died state perished.

Thus Shun played five string qin, sang southern wind poem world governed; Zhou made zhao ge northern rustic sound, body died state perished. Shun's way how broad? Zhou's way how narrow? Southern wind poem growing sound, Shun joy liked it, joy with heaven earth same intent, got ten thousand states happy hearts, thus world governed. Zhao ge untimely, northern defeated, rustic vulgar, Zhou joy liked it, with ten thousand states different hearts, feudal lords not attach, hundred families not close, world rebelled, thus body died state perished.

sentences.zh: 而衛靈公之時，將之晉，至於濮水之上舍。

translations.literal: And during Duke Ling of Wei's time, leading to Jin, reached Pu Water above lodged.

sentences.zh: 夜半時聞鼓琴聲，問左右，皆對曰「不聞」。

translations.literal: Midnight time heard zither playing sound, asked attendants on left and right, all replied 'did not hear'.

sentences.zh: 乃召師涓曰：「吾聞鼓琴音，問左右，皆不聞。

translations.literal: Then summoned Master Juan saying: 'I heard zither playing sound, asked attendants, all did not hear.

sentences.zh: 其狀似鬼神，為我聽而寫之。」

translations.literal: Its appearance like ghosts and spirits, listen and transcribe it for me.'

sentences.zh: 師涓曰：「諾。」

translations.literal: Master Juan said: 'Yes.'

sentences.zh: 因端坐援琴，聽而寫之。

translations.literal: Then sat properly took up zither, listened and transcribed it.

sentences.zh: 明日，曰：「臣得之矣，然未習也，請宿習之。」

translations.literal: Next day said: 'Your servant got it, but not yet practiced; please allow overnight practice.'

sentences.zh: 靈公曰：「可。」

translations.literal: Duke Ling said: 'Permitted.'

sentences.zh: 因復宿。

translations.literal: Then again lodged.

sentences.zh: 明日，報曰：「習矣。」

translations.literal: Next day reported saying: 'Practiced it.'

sentences.zh: 即去之晉，見晉平公。

translations.literal: Then went to Jin, saw Duke Ping of Jin.

sentences.zh: 平公置酒於施惠之臺。

translations.literal: Duke Ping set out wine at Shi Hui terrace.

sentences.zh: 酒酣，靈公曰：「今者來，聞新聲，請奏之。」

translations.literal: Wine abundant, Duke Ling said: 'Now coming, heard new sound, please play it.'

sentences.zh: 平公曰：「可。」

translations.literal: Duke Ping said: 'Permitted.'

sentences.zh: 即令師涓坐師曠旁，援琴鼓之。

translations.literal: Then commanded Master Juan sit beside Master Kuang, took up zither and played it.

sentences.zh: 未終，師曠撫而止之曰：「此亡國之聲也，不可遂。」

translations.literal: Not yet finished, Master Kuang patted and stopped it saying: 'This is perished state's sound, cannot continue.'

sentences.zh: 平公曰：「何道出？」

translations.literal: Duke Ping said: 'From what way comes?'

sentences.zh: 師曠曰：「師延所作也。

translations.literal: Master Kuang said: 'Shi Yan made it.

sentences.zh: 與紂為靡靡之樂，武王伐紂，師延東走，自投濮水之中，故聞此聲必於濮水之上，先聞此聲者國削。」

translations.literal: Made decadent music with Zhou, King Wu attacked Zhou, Shi Yan east fled, threw himself into Pu Water midst, therefore hearing this sound must be above Pu Water, first hearing this sound state reduced.'

sentences.zh: 平公曰：「寡人所好者音也，願遂聞之。」

translations.literal: Duke Ping said: 'I what like is sound, wish to continue hearing it.'

sentences.zh: 師涓鼓而終之。

translations.literal: Master Juan played and finished it.

Wei Ling Gong time, going Jin, reached Pu water above rested. Night half heard drum qin sound, asked left right, all answered 'not heard'. Then summoned Shi Juan said: 'I heard drum qin sound, asked left right, all not heard. Its appearance like ghost spirit, for me listen write it.' Shi Juan said: 'Yes.' Thus upright sit drew qin, listened wrote it. Next day, said: 'Minister got it, but not practiced, please night practice it.' Ling Gong said: 'Can.' Thus again night. Next day, reported: 'Practiced.' Then went Jin, saw Jin Ping Gong. Ping Gong set wine at Shi Hui terrace. Wine drunk, Ling Gong said: 'Now come, heard new sound, please play it.' Ping Gong said: 'Can.' Then commanded Shi Juan sit Shi Kuang beside, drew qin drummed it. Not finished, Shi Kuang stroked stopped it said: 'This perished state sound, cannot continue.' Ping Gong said: 'How know?' Shi Kuang said: 'Shi Yan made it. With Zhou made mi mi music, Wu Wang attacked Zhou, Shi Yan east fled, self threw Pu water midst, thus hear this sound must at Pu water above, first hear this sound state reduced.' Ping Gong said: 'I like sound, wish continue hear it.' Shi Juan drummed finished it.

sentences.zh: 平公曰：「音無此最悲乎？」

translations.literal: Duke Ping said: 'Sound nothing more sorrowful than this?'

sentences.zh: 師曠曰：「有。」

translations.literal: Master Kuang said: 'There is.'

sentences.zh: 平公曰：「可得聞乎？」

translations.literal: Duke Ping said: 'Can one hear it?'

sentences.zh: 師曠曰：「君德義薄，不可以聽之。」

translations.literal: Master Kuang said: 'My lord's virtue and righteousness thin, cannot listen to it.'

sentences.zh: 平公曰：「寡人所好者音也，願聞之。」

translations.literal: Duke Ping said: 'I what like is sound, wish to hear it.'

sentences.zh: 師曠不得已，援琴而鼓之。

translations.literal: Master Kuang had no choice, took up zither and played it.

sentences.zh: 一奏之，有玄鶴二八集乎廊門；

translations.literal: One played it, had dark cranes sixteen gathered at corridor gate;

sentences.zh: 再奏之，延頸而鳴，舒翼而舞。

translations.literal: Twice played it, stretched necks and called, spread wings and danced.

Ping Gong said: 'Sound none more sorrowful?' Shi Kuang said: 'Has.' Ping Gong said: 'Can hear?' Shi Kuang said: 'Lord virtue righteousness thin, cannot listen.' Ping Gong said: 'I like sound, wish hear it.' Shi Kuang had no choice, drew qin drummed it. One play, had black cranes sixteen gathered corridor gate; Twice play, stretched necks cried, spread wings danced.

sentences.zh: 平公大喜，起而為師曠壽。

translations.literal: Duke Ping greatly delighted, rose and toasted Master Kuang.

sentences.zh: 反坐，問曰：「音無此最悲乎？」

translations.literal: Returned to seat, asked saying: 'Sound nothing more sorrowful than this?'

sentences.zh: 師曠曰：「有。

translations.literal: Master Kuang said: 'There is.

sentences.zh: 昔者黃帝以大合鬼神，今君德義薄，不足以聽之，聽之將敗。」

translations.literal: Formerly Yellow Emperor used it greatly to unite ghosts and spirits, now my lord virtue righteousness thin, insufficient to listen to it, listening will cause defeat.'

sentences.zh: 平公曰：「寡人老矣，所好者音也，願遂聞之。」

translations.literal: Duke Ping said: 'I am old, what like is sound, wish to continue hearing it.'

sentences.zh: 師曠不得已，援琴而鼓之。

translations.literal: Master Kuang had no choice, took up zither and played it.

sentences.zh: 一奏之，有白雲從西北起；

translations.literal: One played it, had white clouds from northwest rise;

sentences.zh: 再奏之，大風至而雨隨之，飛廊瓦，左右皆奔走。

translations.literal: Twice played it, great wind arrived and rain followed it, flew corridor tiles, left and right all fled running.

sentences.zh: 平公恐懼，伏於廊屋之閒。

translations.literal: Duke Ping fearful, prostrated in corridor house interval.

sentences.zh: 晉國大旱，赤地三年。

translations.literal: Jin state great drought, red earth three years.

Ping Gong greatly happy, rose gave Shi Kuang toast. Returned sat, asked: 'Sound none more sorrowful?' Shi Kuang said: 'Has. Former Huang Di with great united ghosts spirits, now lord virtue righteousness thin, insufficient listen, listen will defeat.' Ping Gong said: 'I old, like sound, wish continue hear.' Shi Kuang had no choice, drew qin drummed it. One play, had white clouds from northwest rise; Twice play, great wind arrived rain followed, flew corridor tiles, left right all fled. Ping Gong feared, hid corridor house between. Jin state great drought, red earth three years.

sentences.zh: 聽者或吉或凶。

translations.literal: Listeners sometimes auspicious sometimes inauspicious.

sentences.zh: 夫樂不可妄興也。

translations.literal: Indeed music cannot recklessly arise.
Listeners sometimes auspicious sometimes inauspicious. Music cannot recklessly arise.

sentences.zh: 太史公曰：夫上古明王舉樂者，非以娛心自樂，快意恣欲，將欲為治也。

translations.literal: Grand Historian says: Indeed high ancient enlightened kings raised music, not to amuse heart self-amuse, satisfy intention indulge desires, but wished to govern.

sentences.zh: 正教者皆始於音，音正而行正。

translations.literal: Correct teachings all begin from sound, sound correct and conduct correct.

sentences.zh: 故音樂者，所以動蕩血脈，通流精神而和正心也。

translations.literal: Therefore music is that which moves shakes blood vessels, flows through spirit and harmonizes corrects heart.

sentences.zh: 故宮動脾而和正聖，商動肺而和正義，角動肝而和正仁，徵動心而和正禮，羽動腎而和正智。

translations.literal: Therefore gong moves spleen and harmonizes corrects sagehood, shang moves lung and harmonizes corrects righteousness, jue moves liver and harmonizes corrects benevolence, zhi moves heart and harmonizes corrects ritual, yu moves kidney and harmonizes corrects wisdom.

sentences.zh: 故樂所以內輔正心而外異貴賤也；

translations.literal: Therefore music internally assists correct heart and externally distinguishes noble base;

sentences.zh: 上以事宗廟，下以變化黎庶也。

translations.literal: Above to serve ancestral temples, below to transform the black-haired people.

sentences.zh: 琴長八尺一寸，正度也。

translations.literal: Zither length eight chi one cun, correct measure.

sentences.zh: 弦大者為宮，而居中央，君也。

translations.literal: String large one is gong, and dwells central, ruler.

sentences.zh: 商張右傍，其餘大小相次，不失其次序，則君臣之位正矣。

translations.literal: Shang stretches right side, remaining large small follow each other, not lose their sequence, then ruler minister positions correct.

sentences.zh: 故聞宮音，使人溫舒而廣大；

translations.literal: Therefore hearing gong sound, makes people warm comfortable and broad great;

sentences.zh: 聞商音，使人方正而好義；

translations.literal: Hearing shang sound, makes people square upright and love righteousness;

sentences.zh: 聞角音，使人惻隱而愛人；

translations.literal: Hear jiao tone; makes people compassionate and loving toward others;

sentences.zh: 聞徵音，使人樂善而好施；

translations.literal: Hear zhi tone; makes people delight in goodness and enjoy giving;

sentences.zh: 聞羽音，使人整齊而好禮。

translations.literal: Hear yu tone; makes people orderly and fond of ritual.

sentences.zh: 夫禮由外入，樂自內出。

translations.literal: Indeed ritual enters from outside; music emerges from within.

sentences.zh: 故君子不可須臾離禮，須臾離禮則暴慢之行窮外；

translations.literal: Therefore the gentleman cannot for a moment leave ritual; for a moment leaving ritual then violent insolent conduct exhausts the exterior;

sentences.zh: 不可須臾離樂，須臾離樂則姦邪之行窮內。

translations.literal: Cannot for a moment leave music; for a moment leaving music then treacherous deviant conduct exhausts the interior.

sentences.zh: 故樂音者，君子之所養義也。

translations.literal: Therefore musical tones are what the gentleman uses to nurture righteousness.

sentences.zh: 夫古者，天子諸侯聽鐘磬未嘗離於庭，卿大夫聽琴瑟之音未嘗離於前，所以養行義而防淫佚也。

translations.literal: Indeed in ancient times, the Son of Heaven and lords listened to bells and chimes without ever leaving the courtyard; ministers and grand officers listened to qin and se music without ever leaving their presence; this was to nurture proper conduct and prevent licentious dissipation.

sentences.zh: 夫淫佚生於無禮，故聖王使人耳聞雅頌之音，目視威儀之禮，足行恭敬之容，口言仁義之道。

translations.literal: Indeed licentious dissipation arises from lack of ritual; therefore the sage kings made people hear the sounds of ya and song in their ears, see the rites of dignified bearing in their eyes, perform respectful demeanor with their feet, speak the way of benevolence and righteousness with their mouths.

sentences.zh: 故君子終日言而邪辟無由入也。

translations.literal: Therefore the gentleman speaks all day long and deviant ways have no way to enter.

Grand Historian says: Upper ancient enlightened kings raised music, not to entertain heart self joy, satisfy intent indulge desires, will want govern. Correct teaching all begin sound, sound correct conduct correct. Thus music, to move shake blood vessels, connect flow spirit harmonize correct heart. Thus gong moves spleen harmonize correct sage, shang moves lung harmonize correct righteousness, jue moves liver harmonize correct benevolence, zhi moves heart harmonize correct ritual, yu moves kidney harmonize correct wisdom. Thus music to inner aid correct heart outer distinguish noble base; Above serve ancestral temple, below transform common people. Qin long eight chi one cun, correct measure. Strings large gong, reside central, ruler. Shang stretched right side, remaining large small follow order, not lose order, then ruler minister positions correct. Thus hear gong sound, make people warm comfortable broad; Hear shang sound, make people square correct love righteousness; Hear jue sound, make people compassionate love people; Hear zhi sound, make people joy good give; Hear yu sound, make people orderly love ritual. Ritual from outside enter, music from inside out. Thus gentleman cannot moment leave ritual, moment leave ritual then violent lazy conduct exhaust outside; Cannot moment leave music, moment leave music then evil crooked conduct exhaust inside. Thus music sound, gentleman nourish righteousness. Ancient, Son of Heaven feudal lords listen bells chimes never left court, ministers officials listen qin se sound never left front, thus nourish conduct righteousness guard licentious dissipation. Licentious dissipation born from no ritual, thus sage kings make people ears hear ya song sounds, eyes see majestic ceremony ritual, feet walk respectful appearance, mouth speak benevolence righteousness way. Thus gentleman all day speak evil crooked no way enter.
